description:
Recruitment – 
Plan and manage our recruitment initiatives to grow our workforce





Strategic Planning – 
Integrate our employment culture and workforce operations to achieve our business goals





Communication – 
Ensure all team members are aware of current policy, build workforce morale through proper messaging




Adamson Systems Engineering is a technology manufacturer with a strong focus on integration of product technologies, located in beautiful Port Perry, Ontario. Our workforce comprises a diverse engineering group, a global sales network and a skilled manufacturing team. Our high-tech manufacturing facility is designed with lean assembly principals throughout, and our working environment reflects a culture of teamwork and positive ideals.





Day-to-Day Activity
:


Recruitment – Identify existing and upcoming employment needs and execute on filling those roles

Onboarding – Provide a welcoming and safe environment for new employees

Company policy – Lead the modification / creation of company policy with collaboration from senior management to ensure compliance with current regulations and workforce needs

Communication – Spearhead company-wide communication initiatives to ensure our employees are aware of all policy changes, company events and other essential messaging

Timely execution – provide feedback on employees and company policy to senior management

Be aware – latest strategies and tools that are used in Human Resources to improve the efficiency and dedication of our workforce





If this sounds like the fast paced, dynamic work environment you’ve been searching for, let’s get together and talk about you becoming a key member of our innovative team.





Qualifications
:


Minimum 5 years of experience in human resources

3+ years of relevant experience in a leadership role

Successful completion of a post-secondary diploma/degree in a relevant field

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Strong interpersonal skills, experience working effectively in a team environment






Preferred
:


Certified HR Professional (HRPA or equivalent)

Experience with Synerion or equivalent time management software

Experience with conflict resolution and disciplinary processes






Benefits:



Company events

Dental care

Extended health care

On-site parking

Vision care





Our facilities are retrofitted for health and safety, making our campus a comfortable environment to work in. Adamson Systems Engineering is also taking all precautions to mitigate risk against the COVID-19 virus. This includes a thorough COVID-19 daily screening questionnaire as well as disposable masks and hand sanitizer available at every entrance. *As of November 12, all persons seeking to enter Adamson Systems Engineering property must provide proof of double vaccination.




As an equal opportunity employer, we are dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse country in which we live. Adamson Systems Engineering is committed to creating an accessible organization, providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when you are contacted, and we will do our best to accommodate your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request.




We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected will be contacted. Samples of work will be required as part of the hiring process.

description:
Job Description



Human Resources Manager

The Human Resources Manager works as part of the facility management team and directly oversees all areas of Human resources for the facility and manages the HR team.We are looking for a high-energy HR professional who is looking to be a business partner and grow with the organization.



 Performance Expectations 




 Manage and direct the activities of the HR department for the facility.

 Represent management and participate actively on various joint committees to maintain positive ongoing relations between management and employees.

 Develops and implements measures to increase employee morale, motivation and satisfaction, while reducing turnover.

 Coaches and consults managers and employees through the performance management process.

 Develop and implement policies, programs and procedures in all areas of HR for the facility.

 Establish and maintain department records, policies, procedures and reports.

 Employee relations including coaching, mentoring, corrective counseling and investigations.

 Annually review compensation plan to ensure internal and external equity.

 Administer all benefit plans for all employees.

 Review and monitor performance evaluation.

 Recruit for all open positions both internally and externally to fill vacant positions to meet customer requirements.

 Conduct exit interviews.

 Coordinate apprenticeship and training programs.

 Champion Health and Safety program

 Plan and organize employee functions as required.




 Credentials 




 Bachelor’s degree required in Human Resources or related area.

 Five (5) to Seven (7) years of progressive Human Resource experience.

 Must have proven leadership skills.

 Knowledge of all applicable legislation.

 Excellent Employee Relations skills.

 Human Resources certification preferred.

 Previous experience in a high volume manufacturing environment is preferred.

 Experience with production launches is a definite asset.




 Desired Characteristics 




 Able to work in a fast paced environment

 Flexible and adaptable

 Strong oral and written communication skills

 Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution skills




What Linamar Has To Offer




 Opportunities for career advancement.

 Assistance with approved professional designations and fees

 Community based outreach supporting both local and global initiatives and charities.

 Social committees and sports teams.

 Discounts for local vendors and events, including auto supplier discounts.




About Us



Linamar Corporation is a Canadian diversified global manufacturing company of highly engineered products across global industries & markets. From the entrepreneurial seeds planted by our dynamic founder, to the support provided along the way, all Linamar employees are poised for success in this fast-paced and rapidly growing environment. With access to the tools you need to succeed, you will make an impact along with other motivated and engaged people.

Linamar is committed to promoting accessible recruitment as outlined in the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Linamar will attempt to accommodate persons with a disability in an appropriate and effective manner throughout all stages of the recruitment process. Accommodations will be provided upon request.

Human Resources Manager
 - Food Industry




Requirements: 





Diploma or Degree in Human Resources / Business Administration

5+ years experience, ideally within food manufacturing environment

Strong working knowledge of applicable legislation and labour law requirements

Generalist experience including administration and management of benefits programs, time, attendance and payroll programs, full-cycle recruitment and retention activities, reporting, developing and implementing HR initiatives and programs etc. 

Excellent interpersonal skills, able to handle work collaboratively and effectively with all employee groups throughout an organization. 

Proficient computer skills including use of Microsoft Office Programs, HRIS etc

Experienced with USA based plant operations considered an asset

Strong English language skills required. Punjabi / Hindi language skills considered an asset

CPHR designation is considered an asset

HR Manager




Responsibilities:





Administer and manage the time and attendance and payroll systems, and ensuring payroll is compliant with all company policies and provincial legislations for bi-weekly payroll. 

Act as a liaison between Senior Management and the employees and provide support to department managers for personnel management. 

Apply HR management skills to attract and retain quality employees while managing full-cycle recruitment, onboarding, off-boarding activities. 

Manage the HRIS platform and ensuring its full functionality 

Manage and administer the employee benefits program

Conducting research, analysis, interpretation, and making recommendations/ presentations to management

Develop, design, and implement HR initiatives and programs, engagement and retention activities and participate in the planning of company events.

Ensure compliance with appropriate legislations and provincial employment requirements.





Education and Experience: 





Post-secondary education in the form of a degree or diploma in Human Resources.

A minimum 8 years of working experience in Human Resources

CPHR designation is preferred.

Food manufacturing industry experience is preferred but not mandatory.

Ability to positively influence, negotiate, partner and coach managers and employees

Excellent organizational skills, detail oriented, efficient and able to multi-task and prioritize effectible. 

Proficient in HRIS and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)

Excellent written and verbal communication and problem-solving skills. 





Hours: 





Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm with occasional evenings.

Hughes Recruitment is pleased to present an exciting opportunity on behalf of our client Prairie Machine




 

Role: Human Resources Manager 

Location: Saskatoon, SK (Onsite)

 

 




 


OUR CLIENT


 

Our client is a global leader in the manufacture and supply of equipment, battery-operated electric vehicles, and technical solutions for heavy industrial and mining industries. Internationally recognized, Prairie Machine is a leading manufacturer of heavy industrial machinery and machine components. They have a full-service machine, welding, fabrication, and heavy industrial assembly shop located in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

 




Prairie Machine prides itself on being an innovative company focused on safety with great employees producing high-quality products.

 

 




 


THE OPPORTUNITY


 

Prairie Machine is looking for people who are as passionate as they are. People with a desire to succeed, aspire to be great and want to be recognized and appreciated for their contributions. 

 




The Human Resources Manager (HRM) plays a critical role in maintaining a positive corporate culture that supports the personal growth and development of employees. 




 

 We would love to hear from you if you are: 

> Proactive and adaptable in your approach

> A proven relationship builder and trusted advisor

> A true generalist; experienced in all facets of human resources management


 



 





 

 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


 

The Human Resources Manager, under the direction of the CEO, is primarily responsible for planning, organizing, directing, controlling, and evaluating all Human Resources programs including:


recruitment, selection, and onboarding

employee relations

performance management

learning and organizational development

career development, retention, and succession planning

total compensation and benefits administration

terminations and offboarding


 




Working collaboratively across the organization the HRM is responsible to:


­Act as a resource for employee inquiries and concerns

Advise and coach managers on key workplace matters such as performance management, difficult conversations, employee relations, and employee development

Manage all HR related communications including policies, procedures, conduct, and benefits administration

Conduct workplace investigations and lead conflict management

Oversee and maintain accurate employee records and HRIS data

Lead the development and maintenance of HR policies, programs, and practices

Develop training programs that are based on regulatory requirements and best practices

Conduct market evaluations to maintain internal wage bands in alignment with strategic direction

Perform other duties as assigned


 

 




 

 
QUALIFICATIONS


 
 



Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Commerce or equivalent combination of experience and education, required

5+ years of generalist experience

Solid understanding of employment standards and legislation

Strong communication and organizational skills

Proven ability to act with diplomacy and manage confidential information

Demonstrated ability to lead and manage HR core processes

Industry related experience preferred

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization

Competent in MS Office and managing an HRIS

CPHR designation considered an asset

Experience in Epicor HRIS system, considered an asset


 


 





 

 
WHAT OUR CLIENT OFFERS


 
 


Prairie Machine is committed to providing a positive corporate culture that supports the personal growth and development of its employees. We offer a competitive remuneration package including a robust benefits plan, matching pension plan after one year of service, and competitive wages

 




 

 
CONNECT WITH US


 
 


We welcome you to apply or begin a confidential conversation by contacting: 




 

Rosalie Hughes, B.Comm., RPR, CPHR

Founder & Recruitment Consultant

rosalie@hughesrecruitment.ca

306.370.4473




Jaime Perreault, B.Arts, RPR

Senior Recruitment Consultant

jaime@hughesrecruitment.ca

306.381.9503




 


 
 

 

 
ABOUT HUGHES RECRUITMENT


 
 


At Hughes, we have REDEFINED RECRUITMENT! We don’t just place our candidates into a job, we take time to understand you, your passions, your strengths, and your potential. This approach allows us to connect you with a meaningful, rewarding, and lasting career opportunity. 




 

We pride ourselves on our professional and friendly approach. Hughes supports our clients by understanding their unique business goals and hiring needs in-depth, and then sourcing and placing exceptional candidates with them. We believe in success beyond the placement.

HR GENERALIST / ADVISOR






Pharmasave West 
(BC/YT, AB, SK, MB)




Permanent Full-Time, based in Surrey BC 
(flexible/remote work arrangements possible)







As a member of Pharmasave West’s growing region office team based in Surrey BC, and reporting to the Region Director, Finance & Administration, this new HR role provides guidance and support on a range of organizational, cultural, and strategic functional areas related to the employee experience. Areas of focus include employee-employer relations, employee engagement, performance management, recruitment and employee orientation, succession planning, training and development, and employment standards and regulatory requirements.







You will:

Work with management and lead activities that support employee engagement and overall experience

Support healthy conflict resolution methods, policies and procedures

Contribute to the development of the annual goal setting process

Advocate for maintaining a safe, inclusive space for employees to seek guidance and support on any workplace issue

Ensure compliance with federal and provincial employment standards and regulations

Communicate HR polices to staff and Pharmasave stores, including health & safety protocols

Develop, update and maintain the employee policy handbook, and related procedures

Lead the development of training program options for region office employees and member stores







You are:




Up-to-date on employment / labour laws and regulations and their application

Aware of evolving expectations, trends, and technologies in HR

Able to uphold confidentiality and manage sensitive situations with tact and professionalism

Accurate, efficient, have a keen attention to detail

A strong presenter, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Skilled in project management can successfully oversee moderately complex company-wide projects

An accountable, self-manager, with a track record of making sound, well thought out decisions

Proficient using the Microsoft Office / Microsoft 365 suite of apps and programs

Comfortable with change

Someone who likes to have fun at work

A trusted, team player with a strong sense of community







You have:




A designation as a Chartered Professional in Human Resources (CPHR) (or are a candidate working towards this designation)

5 or more years of progressive HR experience, including at least 2 years as a generalist/advisor

A post-secondary education in Business, HR, Organizational Development, or a related field

General business experience monitoring and being accountable for budget management






In accordance with our policies on COVID-19 and Mandatory Vaccination, proof of full vaccination (or recognized exemption under the Human Rights Code) is required. If you think we’re a match, send your resume & cover letter in confidence to: 
HumanResources@pharmasavewest.ca
 
 


(include “


HR job posting


” in email subject line)

.






Pharmasave West embraces diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals eligible to work in Canada. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted by email. 



A trusted household name in Canada since 1981, Pharmasave is a leading independent community pharmacy brand with over 800 member-owned and operated locations coast to coast. Pharmasave is proud to offer Region employees a rewarding career in a dynamic and everchanging industry, with growth and development opportunities, along with a competitive total compensation package.

Careers that empower young dreamers


When you make a decision to work with Children Believe you’re not just doing something great for your career, you’re helping empower children around the world to access education, pursue their dreams and be a voice for change. We know there are lots of career options for talented, top performers like you, but not many offer the opportunity to help children live and dream fearlessly. Children Believe is currently recruiting for the following position: 
People & Culture Manager






﻿
Reporting to the Chief People & Culture Officer (CPCO), the People & Culture Manager will be responsible for providing a full range of value-added people and culture initiatives and services to the organization. Key areas of responsibility highlighted cover all aspects of a “true” HR business partner. This role requires an individual who is a strong team player with a creative and client-focused approach who can enable a diverse and inclusive environment to meet organizational goals.





This role includes, but not limited to:


·       Managing all aspects of the recruitment process for the Canadian operation.

·       Managing/Coordinating the orientation/onboarding process to ensure an engaging experience for all new employees joining Children Believe.

·       Advising/Coaching/Assisting departmental managers and directors understand and interpret human resource policies, programs, and best practices to ensure processes continue to create a fair and equitable work environment.

·       Managing Job Descriptions and Job Evaluation process to assess the relative internal value of positions while ensuring they meet requirements under Pay Equity legislation.

·       Participating in Compensation and Benefits programs to create transparent and clear programs that will motivate and reward your employees.

·       Managing the Employee Relations and investigation processes to maintain a positive and respectful work environment to ensure consistency and fairness, as well as corrective actions when necessary.

·       Modelling Children Believe values and related behaviours through positive and constructive communications practices.

·       Conducting training needs analysis and evaluation of all relevant training and development programs.

·       Compiling statistical reports and metrics towards better understanding organizational behaviours and making positive changes in the organization.

·       Facilitating Performance Management and Evaluation annually, including training and coaching managers to apply fair and efficient processes, ensuring corrective actions are taken and ensuring a successful evaluation process where employees participate in the process.

·       Accountable for end-to-end HRIS system management maintaining data integrity whilst protecting privacy of your employees.

·       Remaining current with best practices, legislative changes, and industry standards, including research and review of policies and procedures, employment legislation topics, compensation, and benefits surveys to present findings and making recommendations towards positive changes in the organization.

·       Maintaining superior communications to manage and deal with complex and sensitive issues where independent decision making may occur.





The ideal candidate possesses: 


·       University degree or college diploma in a related field, Certified Human Resources Leader (CHRL) designation is preferred;

·       Six (6+) years of HR generalist/business partner experience related to the entire HR employee life cycle;

·       Experience working with ADP’s Workforce Now;

·       Knowledge of applicable employment legislation;

·       Proven skills in project coordination and implementation with a collaborative approach;

·       Superior interpersonal skills/communication, conflict resolution and negotiation skills;

·       Excellent problem solving and analytical skills;

·       Quality-oriented; high attention to detail;

·       Adaptable to changing priorities and demands of the job;

·       Strong proficiency with Microsoft skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook);

·       A demonstrated commitment to Children Believe’s Vision, Mission and Values;

·       Cross cultural sensitivity and ability to work in a multi-faith, diverse environment;

·       Satisfactory current Canadian criminal record check required for successful candidates.

·       Experience in non-profit sector and the international development sector and ability to speak and/or write in either French or Spanish will be considered an asset.





Attributes, Traits, and Behaviours:


·       Accountability for results

·       Team player – business partner

·       Strong customer service orientation

·       Confidentiality, sensitivity, diplomacy, and tact

·       Ability to build positive working relationships; ability to collaborate, influence and persuade

·       Commitment to ongoing professional development





Children Believe offers competitive paid time-off benefits and a comprehensive group benefits plan, including health/dental, life insurance, disability, EAP and company-match RRSP.






Location: 
The office is located at 1200 Denison Street, Markham, ON. Staff are currently working from home with some flexibility on in-office activity until further notice (due to Covid-19 related health precautions).





Application Process:



Candidates must apply via Indeed. Attach your cover letter, resume and you will be prompted to complete a pre-screening questionnaire to be considered for the position. 







Children Believe is not accepting recruitment agency/firm referrals.







Applicants must be legally eligible (at this time) to work in Canada.






Consistent with our Child Safeguarding Policy, the successful candidate must receive clearance by a Canadian criminal record check.






Children Believe is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. 






Children Believe is committed to providing workplace accommodations. If you require an accommodation, inform us and we will work with you to meet your needs.







﻿
We thank all applicants for applying, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon’s fulfillment centers (FCs) within North American Customer Fulfillment (NACF) utilize robotics, scanning machines, and computer systems that track and allow delivery of millions of items (and smiles) to households daily. Our HR Leaders provide strategic and tactical leadership direction, executing our people initiatives, providing internal customer support, and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement in locations with up to 6,000 associates.

Amazon’s NACF People eXperience and Technology (PXT) team is looking for a Sr HR Leader with demonstrated ability to think big, deliver on large-scale initiatives, and lead teams through complex challenges.

You will influence across a variety of leaders, while looking around corners to plan for the future of your FC, region, and beyond. Additionally, this leadership role will leverage all facets of data, policy, process, and communication to drive excellence in the employee lifecycle.

The Senior HR Manager is part of a fulfillment center’s on-site senior leadership team, collaborating with leaders in finance and operations to drive strategy and engagement. For us, leaders are recognized as – flexible, thoughtful, socially responsible, and are always planning for the future

In this role, you will bring leadership skills and gain a deep knowledge of the business across Amazon’s growing supply chain network. Expectations are to scale with the growth of the business, lead and develop diverse teams, solve problems with creative solutions, and deliver results on behalf of our customers. This role is key in developing a team of HR professionals as well as personally progressing to scale into a future, multi-unit leadership role as the company grows.

Successful candidates will demonstrate and have responsibility for the following in a fast-paced operations environment:


 Set the vision, direction, and culture of their HR team ( up to 10-20 professionals in various stages of careers) by managing individual and team performance expectations and goals, monitoring real-time service levels and schedule adherence, and holding their teams accountable to meet and exceed performance targets.

 Collaborate with colleagues in operations and finance to work together with the centralized staffing team for non-exempt hiring strategies, and play a key role in hiring exempt professionals and managers within their fulfillment center.

 Thoughtful ability to develop strategic relationships with your business partners – you influence the decisions. You can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues using data, then lean in, consult with, and teach the business how decisions affect their sites and create new mechanisms as they are needed

 A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement

 Understand business goals and recommend thoughtful new approaches, policies, and procedures to affect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity, and development of HR within the company.

 Collaborate with site and regional leadership teams to harmonize site-specific priorities in alignment with overarching Amazon goals (e.g., diversity & inclusion, engagement, and talent management initiatives).

 Deliver results in a fast-paced environment with a high volume workload supporting HR functions and operations leadership.

 Drive and direct all employee engagement efforts for senior leaders, front line managers, and associates.

 Continuously innovate HR solutions and process improvement; specific skills in Kaizen methodologies preferred.

 Lead projects at a site and network level, influence and obtain buy-in from stakeholders, and then drive execution and achievement of the right results using effective project management skills.





Basic Qualifications




 BA/BS degree from a four-year accredited university.

 7+ years’ human resources management experience.

 Experience supporting hourly, front-line employee populations of 2,000+.

 7+ years’ experience in one or more of the following industries: shipping/logistics distribution centers, manufacturing environments, hospitality, healthcare, retail, and customer-facing / customer-service environments.




Preferred Qualifications




 Advanced degree: MBA or Masters

 5-10+ years of experience in Fortune 500 companies.

 Demonstrated success proven through steady career progression within varied HR roles for the last 7 – 10+ years.

 Demonstrated success with stretch assignments that are evidence of superior performance in previous roles (e.g., varied experiences to include but not limited to start-ups, turn-arounds, international assignments, and rapid growth business environments).

 Experience in workforce planning/flex staffing

 Demonstrated success managing multiple priorities simultaneously - orientated on driving results.


Amazon Operations is a 24/7 business and requires flexibility.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

description:
YOUR ROLE





Do you have the eye of a bold eagle, the concentration of a hunting lioness, the social skills to work and communicate with a team? Well, you may be the Human Resource Manager we are looking for. Your mission will be to oversee all aspects of Human Resources Management for the assigned business unit(s) including policies and procedures, recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits administration, labor law compliance, and employee relations. Serve as contact for employees and answers questions regarding HR policies and procedures. Models and acts in accordance with our guiding principles and core values.








WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?






Serve as an important resource to business unit(s) in the interpretation of human resources policies and procedures, legal compliance, employment laws, etc. Partner with HR Regional partners to make sure all policies, procedures and processes are current and being administered according to CEVA direction.

Develop and administer an effective recruitment program that promotes CEVA as the leading provider of services in the industry, interview personnel for available positions and provide guidance to management in the interviewing process. Provide direction regarding recruitment processes and ensure accuracy of information and process.

Ensure consistency and compliance of all hiring procedures to corporate policies and procedures; ensure all required documentation is accurately completed and forwarded to the proper destination.

Provide various reports concerning tracking of employee turnover, PTO, and other performance measurements; partner with business unit management as well as HR Regional leaders to assess results and, where necessary help to develop programs for improvement.

Work with Corporate HRIS to provide accurate reporting of HR information to business unit leaders and other managers; continuously audits information for accuracy and reports any discrepancies in order to maintain data integrity.

Maintain all federal and provincial required logs in accordance with stated requirements. Keep up to date and report any HR related changes to law and/or reporting requirements.

Assist in the implementation of any training/procedure changes regarding compensation/benefits strategies as they relate to their assigned business units. Work closely with Canada's head office HR Leaders as well as compensation to ensure consistency and equity among all employee groups.

Assist in the resolution of any employee-related issues; keeps business partners and Region HR leadership informed. Escalate issues to region HR leadership when necessary.

Help to coordinate CEVA's performance management evaluation process; advise managers of any communications from Corporate regarding timelines and ensure that all reviews are done in a timely manner.

Welcome new employees into the CEVA world; answer any questions regarding CEVA policies; collect any required paperwork and facilitate enrollment into benefits for new hires and during open enrollment.

Complete other projects as assigned by the Senior HR Manager.

Interact with assigned Business Unit leaders on a daily basis to discuss employee issues and ongoing projects.

Partner with Regional HR leaders to review any employee relations issues, policy communications, reporting or any other issues that may arise to support business partners.









WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?






Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment. (Must include excel and demonstrated skills in database management and record keeping)

Excellent organizational skills.

Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to persuade.

Excellent interpersonal and coaching skills.

Evidence of the practice of a high level of confidentiality.







Minimum:




Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business, or Organizational Development or equivalent.

Minimum of 3 to 5+ years progressive leadership in Human Resources.

Specialized training in employment law, compensation, organizational planning, organization development, employee relations, safety, training, and preventive labor relations.

Experience in the administration of HR programs and policies.







Preferred:




CHRP

Experience with Labor Unions.






WHAT DO WE HAVE TO OFFER?





With a genuine culture of reward and recognition, we want our employees to grow, develop and be part of our journey. We offer a benefits package that includes competitive annual leave entitlement with a fantastic holiday buy scheme, pension and life assurance along with access to an employee benefits platform that offers discounts on gym memberships and money off vouchers for a diverse range of retail, travel and hospitality brands. There’s no doubt that you will be compensated for your hard work and commitment so if you’d like to work for one of the top Logistics providers in the world then please do get in touch to find your next role.








ABOUT TOMORROW





We value your professional and personal growth. That’s why we share plenty of career opportunities for you to thrive within CEVA. Join CEVA for a challenging career.

description:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team. 



 At Liberty, we hire passionate people who care about doing the right thing for our customers. We are entrepreneurial, creative, and outcome-focused. Here, your natural talent and achievements will flourish in an inclusive environment of teamwork, trust and continuous learning. We are always pursuing excellence to exceed our ambitions goals, rewarding both the goal outcome and how we achieve it. 


Purpose

Senior Manager, HR Workforce Transformation will be responsible to design, facilitate, and coordinate implementation of new HR processes, skills, and ways of working. Joining the team with skills and capacity to plan, facilitate and lead the implementation of a coordinated roll-out of HR transformation and workforce changes. This role will work closely with the teams in HR and the business o help them understand what is changing and navigate through the change.

Accountabilities


Create a HR transformation roadmap for the ongoing business transformation project including the role out of SAP and other technologies and processes

Responsible for status & issue management relating to the roadmap

Create and implement workforce transition plans (for Customer First releases and other business milestones)

Develop HR & people leader toolkits to effective support workforce transitions

Understand the employee level impacts from the transformation program and other business projects

Coaching HR business partners on the transition plans and role out 

Engagement in HR process design and sustainment in the business



Education and Experience


HR degree, Masters or equivalent

Experience of large-scale transformations

Leading role in organization design programs

Experience with merger and acquisitions

Experience in unionized environments

Experience working across states 




 Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally. 



 For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged – Sustaining Energy and Water for Life. 



 Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction. 



 With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our “Think Global, Act Local” business model.

description:

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


Please note this is a 6 - month temporary contract role




Purpose



Managers contribute to the overall success of the Employee Relations (ER) and Labour Relations (LR) delivery activities (if applicable), ensuring that specific individual goals, plans, and assigned initiatives are executed in support of the ER/LR teams’ business strategies and objectives. Managers are responsible to provide support to designated business lines, for investigating and finalizing high/medium risk ER/LR cases. The focus of this role is to ensure that issues are addressed in a timely manner and managed at the local level to mitigate the potential negative impact of ER/LR issues. Managers ensure that all activities conducted, are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.



Accountabilities




Champions a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge

Leverages experience and expert knowledge of HR policies / procedures, employment law, and knowledge of/within the assigned business lines (and subsidiary companies)/countries, day-to-day operations, systems and technology to provide timely, efficient, innovative, and value-added insights and solutions on employment related issues and concerns tailored specifically to a business line’s operational need; and to act as subject matter experts for the ER/LR team related to assigned business lines.

Promotes and supports a seamless and consistent experience for employees and People Leaders with ER/LR issues and concerns; and updates and maintains accurate and adequate information within the ER/LR case file, on an ongoing and consistent basis, until such a time as the issue is resolved

Independently assesses, investigates and manages ER/LR cases, ensuring consistency and alignment to established compliance regulations and Bank policies and processes; if required escalates issues to the appropriate ER/LR Lead for guidance, as outlined in the Risk Level Assessment document

Independently analyzes and communicates the facts of situations in order to mitigate the legal risk to the Bank, ensuring global consistency to avoid precedent-setting outcomes; exercises judgement and presents the recommendations and risks; provides professional guidance, coaching and support, and provides People Leaders with the appropriate tools and materials that will assist them in resolving the ER/LR issues presented to them, and that will assist them in achieving their goals.

Understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions, ensuring teams meets obligations while respecting operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk, and conduct risk (including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct)

Champions a high performance environment and contributes to a team environment that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates others by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy




Education/Experience Required




Post-secondary degree or college diploma in Human Resources, Business or another related field and/or;

2- 5 years of experience in Employee Relations or Human Resources

CHRP or CHRL designation is considered an asset

Knowledge of how to read and interpret collective agreements (international)

Expert knowledge of employment law and labour law (within the various countries ER/LR supports)

Strong problem solving skills with ability to apply sound judgement

Strong conflict and Alternative Dispute Resolution skills

Strong verbal and written communication skills including strong report writing and presentation skills

Ability to multitask while remaining organized; able to set priorities and meet deadlines

Advanced computer skills in MS Office products

industries: Higher Education
description:
Primary Purpose


As Human Resources Strategic Business Advisors (HR SBA), we partner with colleges and units across campus to support strategic people initiatives focused on the University Plan 2025 in being the 
university the world needs (nīkānītān manācihitowinihk; ni manachīhitoonaan)
.


 Nature of the Work 


Our HR SBA group is part of the People and Resources portfolio, which includes human resources, finance, safety resources and enterprise procurement. Our team collectively reports to the Manager, HR Advisory Services, but works closely with leadership, faculty and staff in our assigned colleges or units, as well as working with HR SBA colleagues across campus in support of broader People and Resources initiatives and professional development.

Our HR SBAs are assigned to support specific colleges and units. Within these assigned areas, we partner with college and unit leaders by understanding their values, culture, challenges and operational needs. We work collaboratively with our specialist groups in the People and Resources portfolio, which includes employee & labour relations, total rewards and talent management, to help achieve people strategies and outcomes both institutionally and across the different colleges and units.

Relationships are at the heart of what we do and it’s critical that our HR SBAs are comfortable and effective in working across multiple and diverse stakeholder groups. From academics to administration, research to operations, we work with all groups in identifying, planning and implementing people practices to advance the mission of the university.

As HR SBAs, we regularly address complexities in the delivery of services and are required to manage emerging and unpredictable events in a sensitive and timely manner. As a result, we must have well developed organizational and project management skills and may be required to work outside of the university’s regular operating hours, which we balance with professional flexibility. The HR SBA role comes with opportunities to collaborate with leadership, faculty, staff and colleagues across a variety of platforms, work in support of operational and academic initiatives and further our careers through professional development and continuing education.

The successful candidate for this position will provide support to non-academic units within Finance and Resources.

USask supports a flexible hyrbrid/remote work environment, which can allow for flexibility in hours of work, to promote a strong balance in our personal and work lives.

For further information on the People and Resources team and portfolio, please visit our People and Resources leadership site.


 Accountabilities



 College/Unit Support 



 We support the implementation and delivery of integrated human resource strategies that assist colleges and units in achieving their goals, priorities, and operational objectives; 

 We support leaders by providing strategic guidance, and creative solutions which assist in the development of initiatives in areas such as talent acquisition, career engagement, problem solving, labour relations, organizational development and change management, to assist the college and unit in meeting its strategic goals; 

 We work with leaders to identify areas of specific focus in which to provide specific HR support and development. 



 Functional Expertise & Collaboration 



 We establish and maintain strong working relationships with a variety of constituents across campus, including college staff, central office colleagues, and service centre partners to ensure success in meeting the college’s and university’s strategic and operational goals; 

 We contribute to the development of the People and Resources portfolio through leading and/or participating in projects to advance the tools and supports delivered by HR to colleges and units across campus; 

 We partner with our colleagues in functional specialist groups to develop a depth of university specific skill and knowledge in areas such as labour relations, talent management, career engagement, wellness, organizational design and diversity and inclusion; 

 We ensure that exposure to risk and liability is mitigated by ensuring compliance with and providing strategic guidance related to collective agreements, labour legislation, employment law, and university and college/unit policies and procedures. 



 Qualifications



 A relevant university degree, preferably in a human resources or related field, along with a minimum of three (3) years’ experience working in human resources; 

 A Chartered Professional in Human Resources (CPHR) designation is considered an asset; 

 Experience working in a unionized environment is preferred. 



 Skills



 A strong understanding and knowledge of several human resource disciplines through progressively responsible positions including labour relations, performance management, diversity and talent acquisition; 

 The ability to influence outcomes and provide guidance to operational decisions unique to a college or unit; 

 Strong facilitation, conflict resolution, problem-solving and communication skills are required to provide strategic supports and guidance across portfolios and functional areas of HR; 

 Knowledge and understanding of issues (including cultural, socio-economic and other factors) affecting Indigenous peoples, in support of Indigenous engagement as a strategic priority at the university; 

 The ability to work collaboratively, build relationships with internal and external partners, and manage multiple demands to meet deadlines; 

 Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office applications. Experience and skills in working within SharePoint and OneNote is considered an asset.

description:
As Giatec’s HR Generalist, you will assist in the day-to-day operations of our growing HR Department through a highly collaborative and team driven environment. 

 

In this hands-on role, you will be responsible to work in various areas of HR, such as recruitment, retention, total rewards, performance management and HR analytics. Our people and culture are the heart of Giatec. You will be an ambassador for Giatec and will promote our amazing company culture and employer brand through various HR initiatives. 

 


RESPONSIBILITIES:


 


 Actively participate in Recruitment & Selection process by working closely with the hiring managers to develop job postings, screen candidates and perform interviews.

 Source, attract and actively network with candidates by attending job fairs and recruitment events and through various social media platforms, such as LinkedIn, to ensure a strong candidate pipeline.

 Develop creative ways to increase Giatec’s employment brand to attract and engage top talent.

 Manage IT requirements for all new employees ensuring assets are tracked and recorded and new hires are provided with all necessary software / access.

 Assist with day-to-day HR operations and facilitation of various programs, such as onboarding, retention, performance management, total rewards, HR analytics.

 Actively participate in the development and maintenance of HR policies and practices to support corporate culture, mission, vision and values.

 Benefit Administrator, ensuring employees are added/removed to benefits as needed, and that all records are accurate.

 Prepare and deliver reports on HR initiatives on a regular basis to uncover trends and anomalies and implement effective solutions.


 


REQUIREMENTS:


 


 2-3 years’ experience and Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Human Resources, Business Administration or other related field

 Strong knowledge of Provincial and Federal Employment Laws and Standards

 Experience with an HRIS and Applicant Tracking System

 Experience with full lifecycle recruiting, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, negotiations/closing and candidate relationship

 Experience working in a fast-paced environment.

 Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external 

 Demonstrated experience delivering an exceptional employee experience.


 


ABOUT GIATEC:


Giatec is a global company bringing smart testing technologies and real-time data collection to the forefront of every jobsite to revolutionizing the concrete industry by reducing concrete’s carbon footprint. 

 

Giatec’s suite of hardware & software products leverages AI and Internet of Things (IoT) to deliver wireless concrete sensors, mobile apps, and advanced non-destructive technologies (NDT) that drive innovation throughout concrete’s lifecycle.

 

Giatec technology has helped over 9,000 projects in 45 countries worldwide meet their construction targets on time, and this number is quickly growing. We have also been recognized by numerous organizations as one of Canada’s fastest growing companies for three years running!

 

We believe that attracting and keeping smart and talented people is a key to our success. We are looking for creative and passionate people to join our rapidly expanding team.

 

Team up with us and reshape your future!

 


TO APPLY:


Do you have some of these skills but maybe not all? We still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique application and learn more about you! Please send your cover letter and resume to us indicating why you believe you would be a good fit for this role. 




At Giatec, we know that diversity, inclusion and sense of belongingness are critical to our success. We believe that employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences strengthen our workplace culture, boost our creativity, and help us to revolutionize the concrete industry.

At Wellington Park Care Centre, we are passionate about ‘Making Every Moment Matter.” We are seeking a candidate that shares our values - a person who has a passion to make a difference, who has a strong moral compass and has a commitment to teamwork. 




Making every moment matter is about improving all the things that make life enjoyable. Things like making someone feel better, making connections with them or for them with other residents, showing them a new song or even just giving them something to look forward to.

 

At Wellington Park Care Centre, we are passionate about providing compassionate care for families' loved ones, where the residents of our home come before anything else. Our values follow a ‘People’ focused philosophy,

Since Wellington Park Care Centre opened, we have offered a community within a community that people were happy to call ‘home’. We pride ourselves in this community connection, our philosophies and the feeling of comfort that can be felt as soon as the door opens. 





Responsibilities of the Human Resources Generalist at Wellington Park Care Centre





The Human Resources Generalist will collaborate with the Executive Director, Director of Care, Department Heads and the Director, Talent Management, and support the overall talent management strategy. This includes recruitment & workforce planning, performance & recognition, leadership development & succession planning, engagement & well-being and the talent management service delivery. 




This role considers immediate and long-term staffing requirements and lead the talent management initiatives in the Home. You’ll be responsible for providing monthly metrics, analyzing trends, gaps and talent management best practices. 





Essential Duties are the technical skills and knowledge that an employee requires in order to perform their role. Below is detailed information on required Essential Duties for your position.






Support of all talent management initiatives at the Home level including but not limited to: recruitment & onboarding, retention, culture & employee engagement, wellness & absenteeism, performance management, talent development and workforce planning 

Measures and tracks outcomes of all talent management initiatives at the Home level. 

Supports the Director, Talent Management and other key stakeholders to explore and implement future enhancements to talent management initiatives and programs 

Acts as the Home’s internal expert of the talent management system in order to be a resource for the optimum use and benefits of the software system 

In partnership with operations, ensures optimal employee utilization during shifts 

Supports and implements recruiting processes, tools, resources and training 

Coordinates recruiting efforts within the Home by sourcing candidates using traditional posting sites, educational institutions, co-op, student or subsidized programs, local media, social media, industry specialty sites to obtain candidates for postings 

Supports managers in coaching, mentoring and developing employees through the talent development and succession planning processes 

Manages the employee engagement survey process in the Home, assesses trends, gaps and outcomes and partners with operations to create action plan 

Supports operations in the management of the wellness and absenteeism program, addresses concerns with management and employees as necessary and aligns with the collective agreement in the Home 

Aligns home priorities with overall organization’s talent management strategy






Qualifications





At Wellington Park Care Centre we take pride in our employees, so your qualifications are important to us. We use them to get to know you and see if we are a good fit for each other. The qualifications needed to join our family at Wellington Park Care Centre are as follows:





Certification in HR (Minimum of a Degree/Diploma or equivalent in Human Resources, Business, Development). 

CHRP designation (Certified Human Resources Professional) an asset 

Minimum of 2 – 3 years of human resources generalist experience 

Minimum of two (2) years of experience working in Long Term Care and /or in the healthcare industry an asset 

Well-developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to interact efficiently and courteously (with residents, management, employees, volunteers and external providers) 

Strong consultative skills 

Labour relations experience an asset 

Strong analytical and organizational skills 

Works well under pressure and in stressful situations 

Ability to work independently and within a team 

Must have the ability to be flexible to work days, evening, nights and weekends to meet with employees as necessary 

Good understanding of HR platforms, software and G-Suite/Microsoft Office 


Must have a clear vulnerable sector screen, no older than 6 months, TB test results less than 6 months old, must be able to provide three supervisory references.



Wellington Park Care Centre recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, staff and others from COVID-19. As such, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, it will be a condition of employment that all new hires have received both doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada, 14 days before start date.







How to apply?





Please submit a resume, cover letter, and references. We look forward to speaking with you, and making every moment matter!

description:
Director, Human Resources



March 2022


 


Overview



 


With over 26,000 members, the Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers (the “College”) is the regulatory body for social workers and social service workers in Ontario. Its mandate is to serve and protect the public interest through self-regulation of the professions. For more information on the College please visit our website at ocswssw.org.


 



The Position



 


The Director of Human Resources, will be an innovative leader working with senior Management to drive cultural transformation and employee engagement, implement strategies for new or improved policies and processes to affect organizational outcomes, mitigate risk and ensure a healthy workplace culture. The Director will be a strategic thinker, facilitating retention, encouraging development, and recommending appropriate staff resources to Senior Management.




Reporting to the Registrar and CEO, the Director of Human Resources will provide leadership and direction to support a culture of continuous improvement, approaching all human resource initiatives with a diversity, equity and inclusion lens. 

 

The Director of Human Resources will have overall responsibility for the development and implementation of HR policies, practices, systems and processes that support a work environment aligned with the College’s strategic vision, principles, goals and culture.

 

In the context of the ongoing pandemic, the Director of Human Resources continues to adapt the College’s hybrid workplace strategy as needed to ensure that staff are healthy, engaged and supported.


 



Key Accountabilities



Responsible for the day-to-day activities of the Human Resources Department, including HR data and metrics, employee files, on/off boarding, employee engagement activities, and wellness initiatives.

Oversees all aspects of the recruitment function. In consultation with appropriate manager, develops postings, screens applicants, coordinates the interview process and develops recruitment materials.  

Participates, in collaboration with the Registrar and Deputy Registrar, in: the annual compensation review as a member of the Compensation Team; regular compensation market surveys; annual benefit plan review and renegotiation of benefit premiums and wellness planning.

Proactively reviews all human resources policies and procedures and recommends revisions/additions to ensure that the Human Resources Manual is current and compliant with employment legislation.

Assumes primary responsibility for promoting, supporting and implementing diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives across the organization. Oversees performance management in accordance with current policies and procedures, and the provides support to the Management Team in relation to the Performance Evaluation process. 

Co-chairs the Joint Health and Safety Committee, providing leadership in the development, implementation, and maintenance of occupational health and safety strategies. 

Serves as a leader and role model, coaching managers and staff on all human resources matters and acts as a liaison between staff and management.

Liaises with human resources experts and/or legal counsel regarding HR matters and uses consultants as needed.



 



Qualifications and Credentials:



 



Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources with CHRP or CHRL designation or similar areas of study

Minimum 10 years progressive experience in a senior human resource role.

Demonstrated experience in organizational development and/or change management. 

Proven experience with strategic human resource planning, and a hands-on approach in ensuring effective day-to-day human resources operations.

Supports the staff DEI Working Group in partnership with other Management representatives and staff.

Assumes primary responsibility for promoting, supporting and implementing diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives across the organization.

Demonstrated knowledge of employment legislation; Employment Standards Act, Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and best practices around diversity, equity and inclusion.

Superior oral and written communications and interpersonal skills. 

Ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities and meet deadlines with accuracy and a high degree of attention to detail.

Strong analytical and strategic planning skills, with the ability to consider the “big picture”, build consensus and appropriately manage expectations.

Exceptional human resources, project management, problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and negotiations skills and a highly professional demeanour. 

Demonstrated leadership skills with experience coaching or mentoring staff through complex and difficult issues. 

Excellent judgment and the ability to maintain confidentiality in highly sensitive and high-risk situations.

Proficient computer skills in Windows environment with experience using ADP or any other Human Resources Information System or talent management software.

Ability to work independently and in a team setting.

Experience in a regulatory body will be considered an asset.


 

The College has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires all staff, including prospective new employees, to be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine. Individuals with valid medical or other human rights-based exemptions will be considered for appropriate accommodation within the policy.





Compensation and Benefits 



 



The College office is in downtown Toronto. 

The salary range for this position is $120,563 - $140,756.

The College pays all premiums of a competitive benefit plan and offers a very generous pension plan.





If you have the background described above and would like to play a key role in advancing the College’s public protection mandate, 
please forward a cover letter and your resumé to humanresources@ocswssw.org by March 21, 2022.





While all responses are appreciated and will be handled with the strictest confidence, only those from applicants being considered for interviews will be acknowledged. 





The Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers is committed to equity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified applicants, including Indigenous peoples, members of visible minorities, persons with disabilities and women.

With more than 45 years of history locally, this family owned firm remains committed to a principled approach to development, ensuring that our buildings are environmentally sustainable and integrated into the communities they serve. If you share our values and would like to work with skilled professionals, Armour is presently seeking a 
Director of Human Resources (HR)
 to lead our growing team from our downtown Halifax location. 

 

Reporting to the Chief Legal & Administrative Officer, the Director of Human Resources will oversee human resources operations of the entire portfolio, which includes Hospitality, Construction and Property Management divisions. From policy development, performance management and training, to strategic recruitment and succession planning, the Director will ensure delivery of HR best practices companywide while retaining the existing family business culture. 

 

The Director of HR will provide guidance and support on all HR matters across the organization. They will demonstrate leadership through the execution of strategic priorities while ensuring consistent application of HR policies and programs across the organization. The Director of HR will understand market drivers for recruitment, modifying strategic recruitment programs accordingly. They will collaborate with internal stakeholders in creating effective staffing planning, hiring programs which support career succession planning and will identify employee development needs.

The ideal candidate will have experience in policy development, employee training, recruitment, investigations and performance management. Your experience is complimented by effective, precise communication with an innate ability to influence at a senior level and manage change. Your understanding of and commitment to confidentiality is exemplary and you exercise strong attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy. Job Description



Boart Longyear is an integrated drilling services and drilling products provider, producing, manufacturing and operating equipment for the minerals industry, with a drilling presence in water exploration, environmental sampling, energy and oil sands exploration. The Company operates in Asia Pacific, Canada, USA, South America, Europe and Africa.

We are currently seeking a self-motivated 
Human Resources Generalist
 to fill a position that will be based in 
North Bay, Ontario
. Boart Longyear is committed to high quality, safety, environmental and continuous improvement practices. Applicants should be able to demonstrate shared values in this area.

This position is a full-time role and hours of work will be 8:00am – 4:30pm Monday to Friday.



The Company



Established in 1890, Boart Longyear is in its 131st year as the world’s leading provider of drilling services, orebody-data-collection technology, and innovative, safe and productivity-driven drilling equipment. With its main focus in mining and exploration activities spanning a wide range of commodities, including copper, gold, nickel, zinc, uranium, and other metals and minerals, the company also holds a substantial presence in the energy, oil sands exploration, and environmental sectors.

The Global Drilling Services division operates for a diverse mining customer base with drilling methods including diamond coring exploration, reverse circulation, large diameter rotary, mine dewatering, water supply drilling, pump services, production, and sonic drilling services.

The Geological Data Services division utilizes innovative scanning technology and down-hole instrumentation tools to capture detailed geological data from drilled core and chip samples. This valuable orebody knowledge gives mining companies the ability to make timely decisions for more efficient exploration activities.

The Global Products division offers sophisticated research and development and holds hundreds of patented designs to manufacture, market, and service reliable drill rigs, innovative drill string products, rugged performance tooling, durable drilling consumables, and quality parts for customers worldwide.

Boart Longyear is headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA with operations around the globe in 40 countries with 5,000 employees. We are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in Sydney, Australia (ASX:BLY). More information about Boart Longyear can be found at www.boartlongyear.com . To get Boart Longyear news direct, follow us on Twitter , LinkedIn and Facebook .
