description:
Human Resources Manager – 1 Year Maternity - Fixed Term Contract




We have an exciting 12 to 14-month opportunity for an HR Manager to support and coach our dynamic teams at the Crystal Lodge, Beacon Pub & Eatery, and Basalt Wine & Salumeria in the heart of the Whistler Village. This is a fun and fast-paced role focused on employee relations, recruitment, and compliance.




The successful candidate will collaborate with our team of talented senior managers and provide them with confident and educated HR advice concerning the up to 150 employees working in these bustling businesses. This hands-on HR Manager will help ensure we have the right teams, in the right place, following important policies and procedures. This is a hybrid role, with the flexibility to work from home and on-site, based on business needs.




The HR Manager reports to the General Manager; with a dotted line to the Director of People and Talent, GolfBC and is without direct reports.





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



Manage full cycle 
recruitment
: job postings, screening resumes, interviews, reference checks, job offers, onboarding in ADP

Support international recruitment initiatives to ensure the businesses are well staffed 

Advise Managers on 
employee relations
 and 
performance management
 best practices

Develop and implement 
policies
 that create a successful, fair, and harmonious work environment


Compensation
 analysis and recommendations to ensure rates remain competitive

Conduct and analyze the annual 
Employee Opinion Survey
; make recommendations for improvement and partner with Senior Managers to implement changes 

Lead and oversee the 
social committee
; manage employee 
engagement
 and recognition

Lead monthly 
health and safety
 meetings; manage WorkSafe BC reporting 

Work with the Operations Manager to facilitate employee parking

Maintain electronic employee 
records


Collaborate with the Head Office payroll team to ensure accurate employee pay


 


REQUIREMENTS
 


Minimum 3-5 years human resources experience; at least 1 year in an advisory position

Demonstrated experience effectively managing employee relations issues

Strong knowledge of employment-related legislation, detail-oriented

Solid administrative skills including MS Office suite

Natural relationship builder with effective communication skills

A team player that is adaptable and thinks on their feet to create best practice resolutions for all

CPHR designation, candidacy, or equivalent preferred 

Creative thinker with a positive attitude and the ability to persuade others for the best possible outcome

Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to multitask effectively in complex situations while portraying a calm, and professional demeanor always

Diplomacy, tact, and confidentiality are essential for this position


 


WHAT WE OFFER


Crystal Lodge is an amazing place to work; we provide our employees a first-class experience. In addition to a competitive salary, we provide: 


15 days of paid annual vacation per annum

A hybrid work environment; a mix of at home and on-site work, with flexible hours

Annual complimentary stay at the Crystal Lodge

Robust extended health benefits package upon start, 50% employer paid

Flexible Health Spending Account 

Discounts at our sister businesses, GolfBC and Table 19

Participation in the winter leisure package

Employee discounts at the Beacon Pub & Eatery, Basalt Wine & Salumeria

Professional development opportunities


 


ABOUT THE COMPANY


The Crystal Lodge is a unique and independent hotel nestled in the Whistler Village, boasting top ratings on TripAdvisor and impressive employee engagement scores. As a newly renovated and busy hotel, with a strong management team, in a bustling town, the Crystal Lodge has experienced great success and is poised for an exceptional future.

For more than 30 years, Crystal Lodge has embodied the soul of Whistler: a warm, welcome, award-winning service, and a purity of spirit as fresh as the alpine air. We are a locally owned and proudly independent hotel enabling us to deliver our service in a means best suited to the Whistler traveler. 




Passion emanates from a genuine and robust people development philosophy. In an industry that is moving further away from personalization, we breathe and sleep that culture. We select our people from all walks of life and from all ages but with one common thread, a desire to succeed in life through hard work, loyalty, enthusiasm and respect for each other.




Please note, only candidates with a current, valid status to work in Canada will be considered. 




Preferred start date mid/ late April 2022.

company: Clinical Research Dental Supplies and Services Inc.
description:
At Clinical Research Dental, it is our mission to support, promote and teach better dentistry through the presentation of clinical seminars, workshops, and scientific research studies and to provide only clinically proven products to dentists throughout North America via a highly trained and skilled technical support staff.





We have an immediate and exciting career opportunity for a full-time permanent Human Resources Business Partner to join our Management Team in our London, ON headquarters. 





The Human Resources (HR) Business Partner is responsible for ensuring key HR programs and employment standards, company policies and functions of the organization are according to company standards and provincial/federal regulations. Primary responsibilities include Recruitment, Employee Relations, Onboarding, Employee Training and Development, Performance and Terminations, Leadership support to the management team, Coordination and facilitation of the Health and Safety programs, Benefits Administration and Corporate Policies and Procedures. The HRBP takes the initiative to proactively make improvements and promptly resolve matters as they arise. You will work with all levels of the organization and report to the Vice President of Business Operations.





Accountabilities; 






Recruitment (40%) 



Coordinate all hiring activities collaborating closely with the relevant manager including developing position descriptions, postings, interviews, assessments, reference checks, offer letters etc.

Actively participate in the interview process for open positions, identifying positive qualifications as well as those that may be of concern. Reduce pool of candidates to a reasonable number for hiring manager to interview. Partner with hiring managers in all final hiring decisions for all position level candidates.

Work with recruiting agencies and build industry contacts to try and keep a constant pool of potential hires in the pipeline.

Development of position descriptions with hiring managers.

Administer/Coordinate all applicable onboarding of new HR employee training (WHMIS, Accessibility Standards, and Health & Safety etc.)

Responsible for all work placements, internships, and Summer Student Programs (where applicable).

Follow up with all newly hired and promoted employees within their first 90 days to conduct informal interviews and ensure they have been on boarded as per company programs and standards.

Provide weekly recruitment updates to Executive Team.






Talent Development (10%) 



Introduce and manage an annual talent review process with the business to include identification of top talent, succession planning, selection, promotion, and transfer of internal candidates for growth positions.

Work in conjunction with senior leaders in determining the most value-add training needs based on business needs and development gaps identified through the talent review process

Focus on developing successors and talent in strategic and critical roles, establishing specific individual development plans and timed action plans for performance improvement, as needed

In conjunction with managers, develop training and other workshops to enhance employee.

Development and ensure proper training and coaching is available.






Performance Management (10%) 



Provide coaching and guidance to Managers to enhance their leadership skills and ensure consistency with direct reports and their development.

Provide advice and support to employees in areas of training, performance, and onboarding, in conjunction with Managers, create action plans for underperforming employees that provide them with the direction and support needed to improve their performance.

Support and guide Managers and employees regarding company policies, HR programs,

administration and interpretation to ensure policies and procedures are managed consistently and in a timely manner.

Drive the MBO (Management by Objectives) program for all Managers and Team Members. Support and encourage all staff to meet goals throughout the year.

Administer, review, and prepare employee survey’s and recommend actionable items based on results.



 



Employee Relations (20%) 



Proactively address employee relations issues with Managers by coaching on how to

investigate and address situations in adherence with company policies and relevant

standards.

Conduct exit interviews for all full-time salaried employees who voluntarily resign and

identify themes and trends to assess and address if needed.

Provide effective coaching, counseling, and progressive disciplinary strategies on all

employee relations issues, up to and including terminations.

Partner with Managers on elevated risk/complex written communications/discipline to be

administered ensuring consistency amongst employees.



 



HR Administration (20%) 



Lead the benefits committee and consult with Insurance carriers and Benefits broker to ensure the benefits program is meeting needs within budget parameters.

Work with the benefits providers and broker to administer benefits in an effective and

timely manner including claims, billing, adjustments, new enrolments, annual renewals,

employee changes, health & wellness initiatives, EAP etc.

Lead all aspects of Health and Safety initiatives and compliance with Joint Health and Safety committee. Ensure OHSA requirements are current and in line with expectations, committee is meeting regularly, WHIMIS training and all related policies and procedures are documented.

Ensure WSIB claims and administration is completed within specified timeframes.

Ongoing administration of corporate policies to ensure team member adherence and compliance with current ministry standards. Lead other HR Program initiatives such as Years of Service, Rewards and Recognition, take our Kids to Work day etc.

Support to the Executive Team organizing and scheduling quarterly and annual meeting events and corporate training programs.

Maintain employee personnel files and other HR records.



 



Qualifications; 



Post-secondary degree/diploma in Human Resources

3-5 years of related progressive HR experience

CHRP designation preferred/working towards CHRL

Previous experience with recruiting, employee development and training

Exceptional proficiency using Microsoft Office programs

Knowledgeable, and with the ability to understand and apply Employment and Health and Safety legislation. JHSC certification training is an asset.

Strong leadership and management skills

Strong ethical behaviour and professional maturity

Knowledge of compensation strategy, performance management, employee relations, safety practices and talent acquisition and the ability to apply this information to ensure compliance with company standards and current provincial/federal regulations



 


We thank all those who are interested in this opportunity. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodation, please let us know at the time of contact.

description:
PIP Canada Ltée (Protective Industrial Products, Canada), avec son siège social canadien à Laval, QC, fait partie d'une organisation mondiale dont le siège social est situé à Latham, NY. Nous sommes l'un des principaux fournisseurs d'EPI et de protection des mains sur les marchés de l'industrie et de la construction, ainsi que l'un des plus grands fabricants de casques de sécurité conformes au monde sous la marque Dynamic. La croissance récente comprend l'intégration de West Chester Protective Gear, Worldwide Protective Products, QRP, Uniform Technology, Boss Gloves et Caiman Gloves dans la famille PIP. Ensemble, nous sommes désormais un leader mondial référencé dans les produits de sécurité et de protection des mains.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un généraliste en ressources humaines. Le titulaire de ce poste aidera les gestionnaires et les employés à comprendre la mise en œuvre des politiques, afin de maximiser le rendement des employés, d'atteindre l'efficacité organisationnelle, d'améliorer l'engagement des employés et de s'assurer que les obligations légales de PIP sont respectées. Le titulaire de ce poste assurera le leadership, la consultation et l'expertise dans divers domaines clés des RH, notamment les relations avec les employés, la rémunération, la gestion du rendement et des talents, la formation et le développement, la planification de la relève et la conformité des RH.


 RESPONSABILITÉS



 Être un partenaire stratégique et travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de gestion de PIP et les employés de l'entreprise.

 Découvrir les défis et travailler avec la direction pour élaborer et mettre en œuvre des stratégies et des solutions afin de résoudre au mieux ces problèmes, lorsqu'ils se présentent. Proposer des solutions alternatives et recommander les solutions les mieux adaptées aux objectifs de l'entreprise.

 Veiller à ce que les politiques et les procédures soient bien comprises et respectées par tous les employés.

 Être très orienté vers les processus en ce qui concerne le flux de travail (comp, changements d'employés ou de gestionnaires, remplissage et soumission de la documentation, approbations, retour au travail).

 Assurer la liaison et défendre les intérêts des employés auprès de la direction si nécessaire. Favoriser des relations de travail positives et l'engagement des employés.

 Résoudre les problèmes complexes de relations avec les employés de manière équitable et objective, en utilisant des techniques appropriées de conseil, d'enquête, d'intervention et de médiation.

 S'assurer que les pratiques de gestion du rendement sont cohérentes et complètes, et que des séances régulières de coaching et de conseil ont lieu et sont documentées.

 S'engager avec la direction à promouvoir une culture de rémunération au rendement et à aligner la rémunération sur le rendement dans le cadre des lignes directrices relatives au budget et aux augmentations au mérite.

 Collaborer avec la direction, le directeur des RH et des opérations pour créer et appliquer les meilleures pratiques opérationnelles qui mettent l'accent sur la qualité, l'efficacité organisationnelle, l'engagement des employés et le développement continu d'un lieu de travail exceptionnel.

 Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de l'initiative sur les talents organisationnels, en se concentrant sur le recrutement, la fidélisation, le développement et la formation du personnel, avec un accent particulier sur la formation des futurs leaders et le développement des talents.

 Travailler en partenariat avec les managers et les consulter pour mener des initiatives de changement qui améliorent les performances de l'entreprise.

 Se tenir informé des changements dans les lois et règlements du travail, des tendances et des meilleures pratiques en matière de RH. Effectuer des recherches et présenter ces recommandations en vue d'une amélioration

 Collaborer avec le service de recrutement interne pour concevoir/développer des stratégies de recrutement à long et à court terme qui identifient et recherchent des talents de haute qualité de manière rapide et rentable.

 Participer à la préparation des données pour les rapports gouvernementaux et les exigences de conformité réglementaire.

 Travailler conjointement avec le personnel chargé de la sécurité et des avantages sociaux en ce qui concerne les congés, la rémunération du personnel, les restrictions et les aménagements du travail, afin d'assurer la conformité et la prise en compte des politiques et des procédures de l'entreprise, ainsi que des lois nationales et fédérales.

 Représenter et promouvoir PIP de manière positive

 Maintenir un comportement et un style hautement professionnels, en établissant la norme que les autres doivent suivre.

 Gérer ou faciliter les activités de RH et les projets spéciaux au fur et à mesure qu'ils se présentent.




Qualifications




Baccalauréat requis et au moins 5 ans d'expérience pertinente.

Membre CRHA un atout.

Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication, ainsi qu'une expérience du travail en équipe.

Une expérience avérée de l'identification et de l'alignement des buts et objectifs des RH sur les objectifs généraux de l'entreprise, associée à une bonne compréhension des principaux moteurs de l'entreprise.

Une connaissance approfondie des disciplines RH, notamment la gestion des talents, les relations avec les employés, le recrutement, la gestion des performances, le droit du travail, la conformité et la rémunération.

Capacité avérée à s'engager efficacement à tous les niveaux de l'organisation.

Capacité à collaborer efficacement avec d'autres personnes pour influencer et mettre en œuvre des processus, des stratégies et des programmes de RH.

Solides compétences en matière de développement des relations

Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes, jugement sûr et capacité à influencer efficacement la prise de décision dans les domaines de l'évaluation des talents, de la gestion du changement, du développement organisationnel, de la gestion du rendement, de l'acquisition de talents et des relations avec les employés.

Solides compétences en matière d'organisation, de planification et de gestion de projets ; capacité à hiérarchiser les tâches afin de répondre aux exigences et de respecter les délais.

Capacité à gérer des demandes concurrentes tout en étant extrêmement adaptable et flexible ; doit être organisé et capable de mener plusieurs tâches de front dans un environnement chargé.

Expérience de travail avec les systèmes de suivi des candidats.

Solides compétences en MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).


Joins-toi à notre équipe en forte croissance !

Protective Industrial Products, Inc. (PIP), a global organization headquartered in Latham, NY is a leading provider of hand protection and PPE to Industrial and Construction markets. Recent growth includes the joining of West Chester Protective Gear, Worldwide Protective Products, QRP, Uniform Technology, Boss Gloves and Caiman Gloves into the PIP family. Combined, we are now a referenced global leader in Hand Protection and Safety products.

description:
We’re looking for a 
Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition [Corporate Recruitment]
 to join our team! The successful candidate will serve as an integral leader on the People Team and lead the end-to-end recruitment initiatives for the Corporate Home Office team. You will design and execute the strategy for all corporate recruitment initiatives. This position will require the successful candidate to collaborate closely with functional leaders to understand and anticipate hiring needs to ensure we are able to deliver on our business objectives. 





As our next Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition [Corporate Recruitment] you’ll ensure the team: 



Demonstrates a continued commitment to an exceptional candidate experience at all times throughout the recruitment process

Are authentic brand ambassadors and have the tools to clearly communicate our story and what makes VetStrategy an employer of choice

Maintains accurate and up-to-date information on all candidates and search activity in the ATS

Are assigned positions that allow them to continue to grow as a corporate recruiter while ensuring appropriate workloads are maintained across the team

Supports the onboarding of new hires at home office to ensure our new employees have the tools and resources to be successful in their new role






In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to: 



Lead the recruitment [end-to-end] of strategic roles within home office, including scheduling and conducting exploratory conversations, interviews with the business, negotiation and presentation of job offers

Work closely with our home office hiring leadership team to identify hiring needs and workforce-planning strategies to ensure we have a pipeline to meet the growing needs of the business

Utilize hiring best practices, salary information, and market specific industry trends to make strategic decisions

Drive the corporate recruitment strategy forward by identifying various sourcing techniques to connect with prospective candidates across various platforms

Attend industry events, job fairs, conferences and campus recruiting events to tell our story as a brand ambassador

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to build strong connections and promote VetStrategy as an employer of choice

Explore the power of data to identify key trends and metrics to help drive the recruiting strategy forward

Leverage our network at home office to support and promote VetStrategy

Build and grow a team of high-performing recruiters through continuous feedback, career development dialogues, mentoring and coaching






What we’re looking for in our next Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition [Corporate Recruitment]



8+ years of experience in a hands-on recruiting role, ideally with experience in a high-growth environment

5+ years of experience leading a team, coaching and developing people

Experience in a corporate recruitment role would be considered an asset

Strong drive to connect with others and have an ability to build strong relationships both virtually and in-person at all levels in the organization

Be a thought leader to our teams by providing expertise and guidance around our home office recruitment strategy

Passionate about delivering an exceptional candidate experience and ensuring our employee value proposition aligns with our employee experience

Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with an ability to prioritize competing priorities with a strong drive for results

An interest in the power of data and leveraging insights to drive decisions with hiring teams

Commitment to creating an environment where our teams can thrive






Why join our Talent Acquisition team? 


We foster an environment where you can thrive alongside people who are committed to your success. We prioritize your overall well-being and provide you with the opportunity to grow in your role. On top of being a great place to work, we offer a competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus potential, a comprehensive benefits offering and an outstanding medical and pet supply discount! 





Interested in learning more, submit your application today!

As the COVID-19 pandemic evolves around the world and in our local community, Conestoga College continues to adjust plans based on the guidance provided by our local Public Health authority. Conestoga College is a leader in polytechnic education. Our career-focused education, training, and applied research programs prepare students for success, support industry and workforce needs, and promote economic prosperity throughout our region and across Ontario.

The School of Business is currently seeking qualified professionals to teach courses part-time starting September 2022 in the

Support students in the use of eConestoga, the learning management system (D2L), as well as maintain course materials within this system

Create and maintain a positive learning environment which supports the diversity of students’ cultures, educational backgrounds, and learning styles

Collaborate and build relations with other program faculty

Master of Business Administration required

Certified Human Resources Leader (CHRL) Designation preferred

Minimum of three years of relevant industry experience

Previous adult or post-secondary level technical teaching experience is an asset

Experience with curriculum development is an asset

Knowledge and experience of computer systems (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite) and educational technologies (e.g. D2L, Zoom) is an asset

Strong leadership and teaching skills with a strong commitment to academic excellence and student success

Excellent organizational, presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills

Le/la généraliste des ressources humaines (RH) administrera les fonctions des ressources humaines et de la paie pour la Société de Chaudières Indeck. Le/la généraliste sera responsable pour développer et d’assurer la mise en œuvre efficace des plans, systèmes, politiques et procédures pour la planification de la main d’œuvre, l’acquisition de talents, la gestion et le développement des talents, l’engagement des employés, la conformité juridique et la tenue des registres, la rémunération, les bénéfices, le traitement de la paie et les relations avec les employés tout en facilitant une relation positive entre le personnel et la direction. Il sera aussi en charge du coté administratif de la Santé-Santé Sécurité au travail dont le comité Santé-Sécurité





Tâches et responsabilités essentielles :



Effectuer le traitement de la paie, assurer les déclarations et les enregistrements d’impôts précis et conforme à l’aide du logiciel RH de paie.

Administration des bénéfices, y compris l’inscription et la mise à jour des données et des rapports sur les employés.

Diriger les efforts du cycle complet de recrutement incluant l’affichage de postes, le dépistage des candidats pour s’assurer que l’organisation recherche et sélectionne de bons candidats de manière efficace, céduler les entrevues, communiquer avec les cadres qui embauchent, l’envoi de lettres d’offre, vérifications préalables à l’emploi et le suivi.

Diriger le processus de résiliation d’emploi en menant des entrevues de départ et générer des lettres de confirmation.

Gérer les relations de travail, y compris répondre aux demandes concernant les politiques, procédures, programmes, les plaintes/griefs des employés, conseiller la direction sur la résolution appropriée des problèmes de relations avec les employés. Servir de point de contact pour les relations de travail.

Maintenir à jour les connaissances et application des lois et réglementations pertinentes relatives à l’emploi et s’assurer la conformité organisationnelle, y compris les directives et politiques sur la loi d’égalité d’emploi. Surveiller le respect des politiques internes et des normes juridiques.

Superviser l’analyse, la maintenance et la communication des enregistrements requis par la loi. Cela comprend l’éducation et conseiller les cadres et la direction sur les questions juridiques et réglementaires liées aux ressources humaines et s’assurer que les programmes, pratiques et politiques soient en accord.

S’assurer à ce que les dossiers et registres des employés soient correctement tenus à jour de façon sécuritaire.

Conseiller l’équipe de direction sur les questions syndicales, l’application de la convention collective, les mesures disciplinaires et la résolution des griefs.

L’administration reliée à la conformité à la sécurité et l’enquête des incidents. Concevoir des stratégies de formation et de développement.

Visites occasionnelles dans l’usine pour assistance, interaction et connexion avec les employés.

Répondre aux demandes internes et externes liées aux ressources humaines.

Effectue autres tâches de support des ressources humaines tel qu’assigné.






Qualifications/Exigences:



Bilingue Français et Anglais

Baccalauréat dans un domaine connexe

Minimum 5 ans-10 ans d’expérience pertinente

Maîtrise des outils MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

Connaissance approfondie de la réglementation du travail et des meilleures pratiques RH

Compétences organisationnelles établies, flexibilité et une capacité éprouvée à effectuer plusieurs tâches, à établir des priorités et à respecter les délais.

description:
Flipp is a retail technology company that is reinventing the way people shop. We work with the largest retailers and manufacturers in the world to help them transform their business and connect them with tens of millions of shoppers through the next generation digital shopping marketplace.

The Senior Talent Manager is responsible for coaching, training and inspiring the Talent Acquisition team. In this role they will foster relationships with senior leaders and executives to drive talent strategy and business impact. They will oversee all hiring at Flipp, acting as a player and coach to help build high performing diverse teams. Lastly, they will have ownership over talent branding initiatives and recruitment events.



Most Of The Things You'll Work On




Grow, lead and develop the talent acquisition team 

Ensure team goals are created, tracked and accomplished

Lead by example through setting, sharing and following recruitment best practices

Create innovative recruitment strategies and manage full cycle recruitment for senior and niche roles. 

Identify and implement DEI best practices 

Oversee Campus recruitment initiatives 

Coach and advise hiring managers on recruitment best practices

Champion a data driven recruiting mindset

Create exceptional candidate and hiring manager experiences

Manage large scale, impactful talent-related projects from inception to completion

Ownership of talent branding initiatives such as LinkedIn campaigns, Glassdoor etc




What You Bring To The Team




University/College degree is preferred

5+ years of recruiting experience in a fast-paced environment 

A proven track record of delivering top talent in your current industry with exposure to hiring a broad mix of roles.

Experiencing building and coaching high performing teams. We want you to share your experience to help the whole team take their recruitment skills to the next level.

You are a champion of diversity, equity and inclusion 

Experience managing large scale, impactful talent-related projects from inception to completion

You have a data driven mindset; you start with the numbers and build solutions based on what the quantitative and qualitative measures tell you.

The ability to work in a dynamic environment and managing multiple priorities

Experience with Greenhouse or similar ATS system preferred




Here’s How We Work



From working with top technologies to sending you to industry-leading conferences, we will make sure you have all that you need to expand your knowledge and grow your career. We have a trust-based culture where all team members are empowered to work in the way that’s best for them to thrive.

Our culture is at the center of all that we do, and it has been recognized through numerous accolades over the past three years including: Best Workplaces in Canada, Deloitte 50 Best Managed, Best Workplaces in Canada for Women, Most Admired CEO and Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.



Here’s How To Apply



If you’re interested in working with us on the future of shopping, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. While experience and skill sets are valuable, growth potential and attitudes are equally important. If you’re prepared to grow dramatically with your team at a world-class learning organization, consider applying. We understand that the most creative solutions require diversity in thought and life experiences.

Flipp is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for all aspects of the selection process.

industries: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Company Background



Tree Island Steel Ltd. (“Tree Island Steel” or the “Company”) is a publicly listed company whose shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TSL. Headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia, since 1964, Tree Island Steel, through its four operating facilities in Canada and the United States, produces wire products for a diverse range of industrial, residential construction, commercial construction, agricultural, and specialty applications. Its products include bright wire; a broad array of fasteners, including packaged, collated and bulk nails; stucco reinforcing products; concrete reinforcing mesh; fencing and other fabricated wire products. The Company markets these products under the Tree Island®, Halsteel®, True-Spec®, K-Lath®, TI-Wire® and Tough Strand® brand names. Tree Island Steel operates in Canada under Tree Island Industries Ltd and in the United States under Tree Island Wire (USA) Inc.



Position Summary



Reporting to the Director of Human Resources, the Human Resources Manager will be responsible for administering all aspects of Tree Island Steel’s policies and functions. The

Human Resources Manager will work collaboratively with leaders and subject matter experts across the business to identify business needs and opportunities and implement solutions to meet the needs of the business. This role will manage a range of human resource programs and services including employee and labour relations, lead the full recruitment process, employee orientation compensation, recognition and development and attendance management and the coordination of related programs.



Responsibilities




 Drive the implementation of Human Resources programs and the development of HR policy.

 Provide advice to first line supervisors and Managers regarding Company policy and the interpretation of three Collective Agreements.

 Act on labour relations matters through facilitating meetings and drafting written responses.

 Ensure that HR plans and strategies are aligned with corporate business objectives.

 Act as a trusted advisor and coach leaders on employee relations, talent management, and conflict resolution.

 In partnership with the Director, Human Resources, lead the talent management process for business functions, including talent reviews, performance management and succession planning.

 Partner with business leaders on strategic workforce planning to ensure that we have the right people with the right skills in the right roles.

 Analyze HR metrics and support the business in making data driven decisions.

 Align with the talent acquisition strategy and process when recruiting top talent to the organization.

 Foster a culture of recognition through employee recognition initiatives.

 Act as a change agent to support critical business initiatives and support leaders in all elements of effective change management.

 Monitor Company-wide training programs and assist in identifying training opportunities.

 Manage the HR support team.

 Oversee the activities of the Social Committee.

 Support major change initiatives and special projects as required.




Professional Requirements And Qualifications




 The successful candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in human resources preferably within a manufacturing environment and in a leadership capacity.

 As well, a minimum of 3 years experience in labour relations, interpreting and administering a Collective Agreement and grievance handling is required.

 A degree or diploma in HR Management will accompany an ability to be tactical, hands-on and proactive.

 Efficiencies and productivity improvements will be a by-product of identifying problems, while creating and implementing solutions.

 A flexible, strategic thinker, with a strong track record of execution in a high growth, fast-paced environment will excel in this role.

 Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.

 Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.

 High degree of proficiency with Excel.

industries: Financial Services, Business Consulting and Services, and Accounting
description:
The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for administering and implementing human resources programs and policies including talent acquisition, retention, employee relations, and change management initiatives.

REIMAGINING FLEXBILITY - RSM’s goal is to offer flexibility in when, where and how you work to help you manage your unique professional and personal priorities while still delivering excellent RSM experiences for your clients, colleagues and communities. As such, this role is open to locations in close proximity to one of our many offices in Canada.

Essential Duties


Project Management responsibilities for core HR processes including but not limited to performance management, talent management, talent acquisition, learning and professional development, and employee/partner engagement.

Assists and coordinates projects for regional HR leadership

Gathers, organizes, and conducts basic comparative analysis from existing reports. Compiles information and delivers clear information to manager

May create reports with direction from manager

Employee Relations/Compliance

Drafts and delivers basic Employee Counseling Reports (ECR) with guidance and coaching from HR leaders

Assists HR leaders with investigations and provides reports as needed

Performance Management/Salary Administration

Determine schedules based upon analysis of reports (TaRS, TAG), make initial recommendations based on findings, and escalate as needed

Participates in leveling/NWT/roundtable meetings, shares knowledge/insights and ensures accuracy of data

Under direction of manager/director may perform analysis of compensation market position



Local Training Delivery


Delivers previously developed training under supervisor. Training includes compliance, orientation, and lunch and learns.



Talent Acquisition - May contribute to key aspects of pathways, intern, and entry-level or ICS hiring process. May have responsibility for:


Recruiting entry-level administrative/support positions, and/or assisting with 2nd-year associate positions

On-campus event planning and management

Candidate interview coordination; campus and/or experienced

Candidate care and communication throughout the recruitment process

Other duties as assigned 5%

Bachelor degree in Human Resources, Business or Related Field

Strong Microsoft Office skills (Excel) required

Ability to prepare presentations including charts, graphics and tables, speaker notes & handouts

Demonstrates a working knowledge of and ability to learn new technology tools: Sharepoint, Power BI, Alterrex, etc.

Excellent communication skills (written & verbal), interpersonal skills, ethics, and cultural awareness

Effective organization and time management skills

Ability to manage multiple tasks

Strong attention to detail




Minimum Qualifications


EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS


Bachelor degree in Human Resources or related field required

PHR/SPHR preferred




Technical Skills



Proficient in all aspects of Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) required 

Basic business acumen and understanding of industry and partnership model required

Ability to identify patterns of basic risk & liability and resolve routine issues required

Exhibits current working knowledge of federal, state, local regulations/laws and firm policies required

Understands compensation materials and principles required




Experience



1-2 years’ experience working as a Generalist within a Human Resources department or related experience required




Leadership Skills



Demonstrated ability to be an effective team member by willingly accepting assignments, completing assignments within agreed upon timelines and willingly assisting co-workers required.




In accordance with applicable law and RSM policy, prospective hires will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19

. If not vaccinated for COVID-19 they must qualify for

an accommodation to this vaccination requirement or participate in testing. 



If you are located in New York, pursuant to current applicable law, you will be required to be vaccinated to enter the New York office and testing is not an option to enter the New York office. 


You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.

Experience RSM. Experience the power of being understood.

RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

industries: Research Services, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Everest’s headquarters are located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada with additional sites in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, and Shanghai (Pudong Zhangjiang New District), China.

Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success.

Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength…that’s us…that’s Everest.

To drive continued success in this exciting clinical research field, we are seeking a committed, skilled, and customer-focused individual to join our winning team as a 
Manager, Human Resources 
for our Toronto/Markham, Ontario, Canada, on-site location, with work from home options in accordance with our work from home policy.

The incumbent will support the Senior Director, Human Resources in providing Human Resource (HR) services to the Canadian corporate headquarters and remote Canadian staff. This will include Recruitment, Training, Employee Relations, Benefits Administration and other topics.



Key Accountabilities




Manage a timely recruitment process for assigned positions which will include job posting, position tracking, maintaining positive external recruiter relationships, establishing new sources of applicants, applicant tracking, screening, assisting management team with interviews, administration of skill-based testing, reference checks, background checks, and preparation of offer letters.

Assist the HR function in the USA when necessary. 

Facilitate and implement HR related training which may include new hire orientation, HR policies, benefit overview, performance management, staff development, interview techniques and general office training.

Provide benefit and pension administration for the Canadian workforce.

Assist with recommending, writing and maintaining HR policies and procedures.

Update data within HRIS system and utilize for reporting purposes

Maintain up to date employee files.

Provide HR assistance to any external auditors.

Manage the semi-annual and annual performance review process.

Perform 3 month “check in” interviews with new hires and exit interviews for any departing staff. 

Foster and develop positive employee relations, and instill a corporate culture inducing strong teamwork and collaboration, striving for high standards in quality and customer service.

Monitor and assist in the compliance with all employment legislation.

Assist managers with performance management which may include preparing and communicating performance improvement plans. 

Provide ad hoc HR services.

Suggest, lead and implement special projects.




Qualifications




Bachelor degree with a major in Business Administration, Commerce or Human Resources.

Human Resource certification required.

Five years' related experience.

An in-depth knowledge and work experience in the areas of Recruitment processes and Employment law.

Knowledge and work experience with Employee Relations, Training, Benefits, Compensation, Health and Safety, and Employee Communications.

Experience with an HRIS System. UltiPro (UKG) preferred.

Demonstrated leadership abilities, including setting goals for others and driving to achieve them in accordance with allocated resources, budgets, and timelines.

Excellent interpersonal, oral. and written communication skills. Demonstrated strong negotiation and presentation skills.

Flexible, organized, with an ability to multi-task and a strong desire to learn and grow in HR management.

Strong ability in problem-solving, including conflict resolution.

Able to work flexible hours when required to provide internal and external HR services.

Strong computer skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.


To find out more about Everest Clinical Research and to review other opportunities, please visit our website at www.ecrscorp.com

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Everest is committed to upholding the principles of dignity, independence, integration, and equal opportunity. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and upon request we will provide accommodations for candidates participating in any part of our recruitment and selection process.

industries: Software Development, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly.

The International Benefits Manager will be a leading voice in the on-going strategy, analysis, administration, complex issue resolution and communication of Affirm’s international benefit plans and programs including vacation, holiday, time off, sick pay, unemployment, retirement plans, disability, flexible spending, service awards, group health/medical/dental coverage, vendor management, wellness and health education initiatives, and life insurance.



What You’ll Do



The International Benefits Manager administers and communicates the company's international benefits program in regards to plan options, policy features, enrollment and other requirements. This person will be responsible for surveying market data in order to determine the company’s competitive position in employee benefits. This role will be critical in planning, developing, and redesigning Affirm’s international benefits programs and analyzing benefit costs.


 Use professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways 

 Work on problems of complex scope where analysis of data requires an in-depth evaluation of identifiable factors 

 Exercise judgement in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results 

 Design, implement and administer international benefit policies and programs 

 Develop international benefits training and communications 

 Own the annual international open enrollment cycles 

 Ensure the reliability, accuracy and security of benefits data used for reporting and analysis purposes 

 

What We Look For




 8+ years of experience in benefits 

 Preference for experience with benefits design and management in Europe, Asia-Pacific and South America 

 Strong team orientation with collaborative style; ability to work effectively across internal teams, communicating clearly and comprehensively to meet project deadlines  

 Leads with strong judgement and integrity in approaching their work; able to maturely handle sensitive and confidential information 

 Deep subject matter expertise, including trends, thought leadership and practical hands-on administration 

 Highly effective verbal and written communications skills ; able to distill complex concepts/information to employees and Senior Leaders in a digestible manner 

 Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple high, and potentially shifting, priorities in a fast-paced environment 

 Attention to detail, strong sense of responsibility and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively  

 Strong customer service background  

 Knowledge of regulatory requirements and the ability to establish and maintain compliance of all international plans and programs 



Location - Remote Canada


Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company ! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account.

[Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act , the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here .

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways—not just candidates who check all the boxes.



Inclusivity



At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and that’s why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2020 DEI Report .

We also believe It’s On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy , or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

industries: Veterinary Services
description:
We’re looking for a 
Talent Acquisition Manager [RVT]
 to join our team! The successful candidate will be a part of a team of professionals who are dedicated to supporting our clinics across Canada. In this role, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to lead the recruitment for RVT’s and students to ensure we have a pipeline of candidates to support our growing workforce requirements.








In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to: 



Design and implement a strategic plan to support our RVT hiring needs across Canada

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to build strong connections and promote VetStrategy as an employer of choice for students and RVT’s

Attend industry events, job fairs, conferences and campus recruiting events to tell our story as a brand ambassador

Work closely with our Field Operations team to ensure a strong partnership with the Operations function

Create innovative sourcing strategies to build a pipeline of qualified talent

Utilize best hiring practices, salary information, and market specific industry trends to make strategic decisions

Leverage our RVT network to support and promote VetStrategy









What we’re looking for in our next Talent Acquisition Manager [RVT] 



Registered Veterinary Technician with a passion for helping people find meaningful and fulfilling careers

5+ years of experience leading a team, coaching and developing people, ideally within the veterinary industry

Strong drive to connect with others and have an ability to build strong relationships both virtually and in-person

Be a thought leader to our teams by providing expertise and guidance around our RVT recruitment strategy

Commitment to creating an environment where our teams can thrive









Please note: this is a remote based role with approximately 30% travel [across Canada]









Why join our Talent Acquisition team? 


We foster an environment where you can thrive alongside people who are committed to your success. We prioritize your overall well-being and provide you with the opportunity to grow in your role. On top of being a great place to work, we offer a competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus potential, a comprehensive benefits offering and an outstanding medical and pet supply discount!








Interested in learning more, submit your application today!

job_title: P&O (Human Resources) Director, Pet Nutrition Canada
industries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing
description:
The P&O Director, Pet Nutrition Canada works designs and deploys talent, people, and capability initiatives that advance the core business and people strategies, and provides day to day leadership for the P&O function. As the senior culture champion of the Pet Nutrition segment in the country, the P&O Director, Pet Nutrition Canada will role model and coach the Five Principles with the leadership team and liaise with senior P&O leaders in other segments, ensuring Mars is a great place to work.

The P&O Director, Pet Nutrition Canada reports to the General Manager, Pet Nutrition Canada and indirectly into the VP P&O North America. This leader is a critical member of the Canada Pet Nutrition Leadership Team (cross functional group of leaders in sales, dCommerce, marketing, finance) and the North American P&O Leadership Team. The P&O Director, Canada will partner with centralized specialist P&O teams in Rewards, Associate Relations, Associate Wellness, Talent Acquisition, and Talent Management to deliver day-to-day and transformational people strategies.

More specifically, the P&O Director, Pet Nutrition Canada will be accountable for the following:


Ensuring consistent focus on creating a One Canada associate experience

Partnering with the General Manager and Leadership Team to establish short and long-term goals to drive business success, provide leadership to the business while maintaining strategic alignment of the people agenda with the business agenda and ensuring associate advocacy;

Aligning P&O programs, processes, and initiatives with the unit business strategy; championing the P&O agenda with senior leadership and proactively addressing the people needs of the business to provide effective integrated solutions;

Drive the organization to bring to life a talent strategy that supports growth and associate development / engagement; keep a pulse of the business and develop appropriate OD interventions that strength the health of the organization and enable a high performing culture.

Drive efficiency across the P&O operating model by: facilitating the adoption of Mars signature programs, leading and managing unit specific projects, providing P&O support to units, and interfacing with Line Managers.

Guide, support, and position Mars Associate Services and Line Managers to most effectively and efficiently serve Mars associates. Address any escalated issues, as needed.



What are we looking for?



Minimum 8-10 years experience as HR generalist/professionalism/BP. Experience with MNC or global corporation with ability to translate global programs into locally suitable solutions.

Strong consulting skills and ability to leverage expertise to design and deploy impactful people solutions.

Good business acumen and experience

Ability to work independently and efficiently, with minimal supervision in a fast paced environment.

Good organization skills and the ability to multi-task and capable of establishing priorities

Strong analytical, consultation skill, coaching and problem-solving

Must be able to demonstrate strong verbal written communication



What can you expect from Mars?



Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.

Join a purpose driven company, where were striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.

Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.

An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

industries: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Research Services, and Maritime Transportation
description:
About RBR


Founded in 1973, RBR designs and manufactures oceanographic instruments in Ottawa, Ontario to measure the blue planet. The effects of climate change are being seen from the ocean’s abyss to the polar ice caps and our sensors quantify this change to support better analysis, improved planning, and more effective mitigation strategies. Mounted on underwater drones, dropped out of planes, and sent to the bottom of the ocean – sometimes for years at a time – all in an effort to get precise and accurate data to support climate research, our instruments measure water parameters in some of the harshest environments on the planet. We have been fortunate to be able to partner with some of the world's leaders in the field of ocean science, like Fisheries and Oceans Canada, The Scripps Institution of Oceanography, The Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, The Norwegian Polar Institute, and The British Antarctic Survey, and we're proud to be supporting world-changing scientific research.

At RBR, our people care about the environment, our community, their work, and each other. We value curiosity, experimentation, and doing the right thing, and while we do some serious work to support cutting-edge science, we like to have fun while we're doing it. Our Ottawa team recently moved our HQ to a new space that includes large meeting spaces to encourage collaboration, a sweet snack room, a large and modern lunch area, and even a fish tank!





About the Role


We're looking for a passionate people leader to drive HR strategy and build on our unique people-forward culture at RBR. You will lead a small but mighty team of HR professionals to develop programs and initiatives that align with our values and support our mission. You're someone who is inspired by cutting-edge technology designed to solve big problems. You're a seasoned business partner, adept at anticipating the broader implications of HR decisions both inside and outside the business. You're an enthusiastic brand ambassador that understands how to tell a compelling, authentic, and differentiated story about what it means to build a career at RBR. You're motivated by developing people and cultivating future leaders, helping employees to create meaningful work experiences in their day-to-day.





What You'll Do:



As a key member of RBR's senior leadership team, you'll report directly to the President and provide strategic focus to HR and people-related issues and initiatives.

You'll drive improvements to workforce planning, talent acquisition, and talent management strategies to support organizational development and business objectives.

You'll connect and develop exceptional rapport with employees and be a nexus between staff and leadership.

You'll support your team in developing systems, processes, and best practices to support the organization's growth and evolution.

You'll oversee and support all HR operational activities.

You'll provide coaching, guidance, and advisory support to the HR team, employees, and leaders.

You'll lead total rewards assessments and analyses of RBR compensation, perks, and benefits programs to ensure equity, market competitiveness, and alignment with organizational objectives.






What You Bring:



University degree in Human Resources or a related field or a suitable combination of education, experience, or other relevant training.

Certified Human Resources Leader (CHRL) designation preferred.

Exceptional listening skills and ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.

Experience in senior leadership roles, with a track record of influencing change and making things happen.

Experience in scaling up technology organizations.

Experience developing and implementing organizational design, total rewards, engagement, and talent management strategies.

Strong IT systems proficiency with HRIS tools and business applications like Microsoft Office suite and Google suite.

Ability to work effectively under pressure and adapt to varied and changing priorities.

Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.






Why Join RBR?



The ability to make an impact and support climate research

Electric vehicle incentive of up to $10,000 - plus on-site charging stations

Charitable donation matching of up to $1,000 annually to charities of your choosing

A wide range of employee wellbeing initiatives

$200 annual fitness reimbursement program

Corporate fitness membership program

Local discounts with our rewards program

Employee recognition program

Work from wherever Wednesdays

Employee Assistance Program

Competitive vacation, pay, and benefits

20 days annual vacation, plus time off between Christmas Day and New Year's Day

Immediate comprehensive benefits plan (medical, dental, etc.)

Competitive market salary

RRSP contribution matching

Referral program for new hires

description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly.

The International Benefits Manager will be a leading voice in the on-going strategy, analysis, administration, complex issue resolution and communication of Affirm’s international benefit plans and programs including vacation, holiday, time off, sick pay, unemployment, retirement plans, disability, flexible spending, service awards, group health/medical/dental coverage, vendor management, wellness and health education initiatives, and life insurance.



What You’ll Do



The International Benefits Manager administers and communicates the company's international benefits program in regards to plan options, policy features, enrollment and other requirements. This person will be responsible for surveying market data in order to determine the company’s competitive position in employee benefits. This role will be critical in planning, developing, and redesigning Affirm’s international benefits programs and analyzing benefit costs.


 Use professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways 

 Work on problems of complex scope where analysis of data requires an in-depth evaluation of identifiable factors 

 Exercise judgement in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results 

 Design, implement and administer international benefit policies and programs 

 Develop international benefits training and communications 

 Own the annual international open enrollment cycles 

 Ensure the reliability, accuracy and security of benefits data used for reporting and analysis purposes 

 

What We Look For




 8+ years of experience in benefits 

 Preference for experience with benefits design and management in Europe, Asia-Pacific and South America 

 Strong team orientation with collaborative style; ability to work effectively across internal teams, communicating clearly and comprehensively to meet project deadlines  

 Leads with strong judgement and integrity in approaching their work; able to maturely handle sensitive and confidential information 

 Deep subject matter expertise, including trends, thought leadership and practical hands-on administration 

 Highly effective verbal and written communications skills ; able to distill complex concepts/information to employees and Senior Leaders in a digestible manner 

 Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple high, and potentially shifting, priorities in a fast-paced environment 

 Attention to detail, strong sense of responsibility and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively  

 Strong customer service background  

 Knowledge of regulatory requirements and the ability to establish and maintain compliance of all international plans and programs 



Location - Remote Canada


Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company ! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account.

job_title: HR Business Partner and HR Generalist
industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
Human Resources Business Partner and Generalist (2 roles)


Our client, located in Waterloo Region, is a highly successful family-run business with multiple locations and product lines. Their steady growth has led to the creation of these two additional roles for their HR team. This is a remarkable business success story because their customer-focus and Core Values set them apart in everything they do.

Why Join Our Team?


Family oriented, caring work culture where people enjoy each other’s company

You’ll experience the full benefits of their Core Values that provide a competitive advantage in the marketplace

Opportunity to demonstrate and grow your HR expertise as you support the HR activities for several divisions in the area

Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package

Working with an entrepreneurial team with exceptional growth potential




Job Description



The Human Resources Business Partner and Generalist, support the corporate culture and works to continuously support a fair, safe, and healthy workplace in accordance with its Mission, Vision and Vales. These two positions will play an important role in all aspects of Human Resources and possess the competencies to properly perform the duties and responsibilities in an environment of continuous improvement.


HR Business Partner




Responsibilities




Establishes credibility and strong working relationships throughout the business

Supports a combination of multiple plants and sales offices

Responsible for the strategic direction of Human Resources

Continues the development of the HR Team and as a strategic partner

Develops a culture that supports the Core Values

Possess a “change management” philosophy in the context of Continuous Improvement

Oversees all activities of the Human Resources Team and supports with any activities as required




Requirements




 Proactive with superior problem-solving skills, cognitive ability, passion to succeed and social intelligence

 Superior Team Building skills and experience

 Completion of a post-secondary degree in HR/Business and/or has achieved the CHRP designation, or equivalent education

 5 - 7 years experience as an HR Manager with multi-site experience

 Ability to be agile in thinking and approach to issues - not a black and white thinker

 Highly organized and detail-oriented

 Comfort and familiarity with HR software and solid computer skills including Word



HR Generalist




Responsibilities




Establishes credibility and strong working relations

All aspects of the recruitment and selection process, onboarding, engagement, employee relations, wage/benefit surveys, performance evaluation process

HR administration, documentation, and payroll processing

Fosters a Safe and Healthy work environment

Coordinates WSIB claims and return to work programs

Maintain and update employee files

Administrates the benefit plan




Requirements




 Proactive with good problem-solving skills, cognitive ability, passion to succeed and social intelligence

 Builds working relationships and credibility at all levels of the company

 Completion of a post-secondary degree or diploma in Human Resources and working towards your CHRP designation

 3-5 years experience in a Generalist role with multi-site exposure

 Become an articulate spokesperson for our Mission, Vision and Values

 Ability to be agile in thinking and approach to issues - not a black and white thinker

 Highly organized and detail-oriented


In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, we are an equal opportunity employer and strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community. We encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans and people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any part of the recruitment process, please let us know and we will be pleased to facilitate that for you.

job_title: Manager, Talent Acquisition Strategy and Partnerships
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, and Financial Services
description:
At BRP, we market world-class recreational products like Ski-Doo, Can-Am and Sea-Doo and we're on the hunt for world-class talent to pursue our journey of moving people in emotions rather than distance. We are looking for a Manager, Talent Acquisition Strategy and Partnership to help us develop BRP's strategy for future hiring practices and talent pools. She


he will be reporting to the Director of Talent Acquisition Strategy and Employer Brand and will be supported by one analyst (to be hired over the next weeks).


So, if you are a great strategist, with an entrepreneurial and team player mindset, if you view the world as a playground, if you tend to think big and if you enjoy connecting the dots when facing complex challenges, this position could be for you.



You’ll Have The Opportunity To




Conduct market research on critical talent pools for the organization (characteristics, ecosystem, expectations, etc.)

Define strategy in partnership with the leaders in the organization to build and engage each critical talent pool

Research, build and present business cases on strategic initiatives (new partnerships, new hiring models, new office location, upskilling/reskilling plan, etc.) to feed the talent pools and/or increase market attractiveness of BRP for potential candidates

Conduct market watch on recruitment trends and sourcing opportunities

Source, structure, and negotiate potential partnerships that will benefit both BRP and partners in terms of talent attraction and development

Work with the Director of Talent acquisition to monitor the progress of the Talent Acquisition strategy




You Are The Right Fit If You




Have 4-6 years of experience in management consulting or corporate strategy or business development 

Have excellent analytical skills with a strong ability to synthesize information into actionable recommendations

Have a track record of excellence in strategic thinking, project management, and advanced problem solving

Have great communication and influence skills 

Are efficient to conduct research and transform data into actionable insights 

Feel comfortable in developing and presenting business cases to senior leadership and executives 

Have a keen interest in business development and innovative solutions 

Are a self-starter 

Have international work experience 

Are fluent in English and French, both written and spoken.



WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?



Access to high impact, high visibility strategic initiatives 

Opportunities to learn on the job and build a career aligned with your own level of ambition 

Diversity of initiatives and interventions

Access to a mentorship program and educational resources

Flexible scheduling including summer hours

Discounts on BRP products

Competitive salary and annual bonus

Industry-leading healthcare insurance and pension plan

Generous paid time away

Access to a discounted gym membership 



WELCOME TO BRP


We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 14,500 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours.

description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly.

The International Benefits Manager will be a leading voice in the on-going strategy, analysis, administration, complex issue resolution and communication of Affirm’s international benefit plans and programs including vacation, holiday, time off, sick pay, unemployment, retirement plans, disability, flexible spending, service awards, group health/medical/dental coverage, vendor management, wellness and health education initiatives, and life insurance.



What You’ll Do



The International Benefits Manager administers and communicates the company's international benefits program in regards to plan options, policy features, enrollment and other requirements. This person will be responsible for surveying market data in order to determine the company’s competitive position in employee benefits. This role will be critical in planning, developing, and redesigning Affirm’s international benefits programs and analyzing benefit costs.


 Use professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways 

 Work on problems of complex scope where analysis of data requires an in-depth evaluation of identifiable factors 

 Exercise judgement in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results 

 Design, implement and administer international benefit policies and programs 

 Develop international benefits training and communications 

 Own the annual international open enrollment cycles 

 Ensure the reliability, accuracy and security of benefits data used for reporting and analysis purposes 

 

What We Look For




 8+ years of experience in benefits 

 Preference for experience with benefits design and management in Europe, Asia-Pacific and South America 

 Strong team orientation with collaborative style; ability to work effectively across internal teams, communicating clearly and comprehensively to meet project deadlines  

 Leads with strong judgement and integrity in approaching their work; able to maturely handle sensitive and confidential information 

 Deep subject matter expertise, including trends, thought leadership and practical hands-on administration 

 Highly effective verbal and written communications skills ; able to distill complex concepts/information to employees and Senior Leaders in a digestible manner 

 Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple high, and potentially shifting, priorities in a fast-paced environment 

 Attention to detail, strong sense of responsibility and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively  

 Strong customer service background  

 Knowledge of regulatory requirements and the ability to establish and maintain compliance of all international plans and programs 



Location - Remote Canada


Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company ! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account.
