description:
Are you looking for more than a job? At World Vision Canada we offer challenging careers that change the lives of children all over the world and it will change yours too. Come and be part of a team of 400 Canadians with a vision for the world: Life in all its fullness for every child.

You will experience Christian faith in action helping to make real and lasting change in the lives of the world’s most vulnerable children. Join the World Vision Canada team and be part of a powerful and effective force for good:

For Children. For Change. For Life.


 Position 

 : Associate, Employee Experience 



 Reports to: 

 People & Culture Manager, Talent Shared Services 



 Position Term: 

 Full Time Temporary (12 Months) 



 Primary Location:Mississauga, Ontario, Canada 



 Workplace Type:Flexible Hybrid 


#LI- OA1


Job Description


We are looking for an enthusiastic People & Culture Employee Experience Associate with a passion for creating and delivering an engaging and seamless end to end employee experience.Reporting to the People & Culture Manager, Talent Shared Services, the Associate will have a passion for hospitality, building relationships, communication, and inclusion to ensure all team members feel a sense of belonging and purpose at World Vision Canada.


Responsibilities



 Develop a best-in-class end-to-end onboarding and integration process to ensure employees at all levels are integrated and fully assimilated into the organization effectively and feel that they belong; coordinate with internal partners such as Digital & IT, Facilities, and hiring managers to provide a seamless onboarding experience. 

 Ensure all aspects of new hire compliance and internal learning modules are completed within the required timeline by all incoming employees. 

 Meet with new hires to provide organizational information as well as coordinate other key meet-and-greet sessions with key internal stakeholders, including senior leaders. Conduct presentations and moderate online platforms to ensure new hires have timely and required information. 

 Ensure the employee offboarding process is seamless with the coordination of all relevant internal partners. 

 Conduct and analyze onboarding and exit surveys, and monitor Our Voice and Pulse Survey data, to obtain insights and identify employee experience trending; provide recommendations and best practice learning to improve experience programs and processes. 

 Work with internal teams to test and continuously improve digitally enabled processes for all employee systems to ensure processes are effective and efficient. 

 In collaboration with Brand & Communications Engagement team, support the execution of our Employer Brand strategy both internally and externally including leading the Top 100 Employers project annually. 

 Oversight of all People & Culture online employee resources including intranet and social networking platforms; coordinate communications with internal partners. 

 Be an internal champion for legislative-related People & Culture policies and procedures including leaves, health & safety, accessibility, and other requirements; be a member of internal teams and/or working groups related to employee experience initiatives. 

 Support the People & Culture team with special initiatives as required. 




Qualifications



 Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management or related field 

 3+ years’ work experience in a similar role 

 Progress towards CHRP designation 

 Good knowledge of Canadian employment legislation 

 Hands-on experience with Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS); and strong skills in Microsoft Office including Teams and other intranet and organizational social network platforms 

 Solid communication skills (verbal and written) 

 Strong team spirit and collaboration 

 Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information 




 Why consider us? 



 World Vision Canada has consistently been awarded Canada’s and the GTA’s top employers. Other awards granted are for financial transparency, marketing, customer service and for the work we do in the field. 

 We are Canada’s largest development, relief and advocacy non-profit. 

 We embody an agile mindset here. 

 You get competitive pay and benefits. Our benefits start at day 1. 

 You get extra time off for restoration. We close for an additional day on long weekends, 6 times a year. 



We bring life-saving support in times of disaster. We help poor communities to take charge of their futures. We provide small loans and training that boost family livelihoods. We work with policy makers to change the way the world is run. Our Christian faith teaches us that every child, regardless of gender, faith or race, is a precious gift to the entire world - and that their wellbeing concerns us all. We shall never rest while children suffer in situations that can be changed.

GTA's Top 100

Our Core Values: We are committed to the Poor. We are Christian. We are Stewards. We value People. We are Partners. We are Responsive.

Qualified candidates must be able to demonstrate a commitment to the core values and mission of the World Vision partnership.

World Vision Canada takes our Safeguarding responsibilities seriously and we provide an environment that is safe for our child and adult beneficiaries. We have strong recruitment procedures to make sure the safest and most suitable people work with the children in our programs. We provide our staff and volunteers with ongoing supervision, support and training in their work with child and adult beneficiaries.

World Vision Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Thank you for your interest; however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Apply Now

job_title: Partenaire en recrutement - Contrat de 12 mois
industries: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Changez l’avenir avec nous


Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes dévouées et talentueuses qui sont en mesure de relever des défis en constante évolution ainsi que de répondre aux besoins de clients ou aux questions de collègues en appliquant des concepts intelligents et en faisant preuve de créativité. Nous favorisons le changement et travaillons avec des personnes animées par la curiosité qui réinventent l’avenir du travail. Rejoignez-nous et, ensemble, nous nous concentrerons sur ce qui est vraiment important : améliorer la vie avec de nouvelles idées et les plus récentes technologies à l’échelle mondiale.


Pourquoi vous aimerez travailler pour Siemens?




Liberté et conciliation travail-famille : adoptez notre environnement de travail souple et bénéficiez d’un horaire flexible, du télétravail et d’espaces de travail numériques 

Resolution de problèmes parmi les plus importants à l’échelle mondiale : prenez part à des projets passionnants et novateurs

Environnement mobilisateur et stimulant qui évolue rapidement et comprend une technologie de fine pointe

Occasions de faire progresser votre carrière et de bénéficier de programmes de mentorat à l’échelle locale et mondiale.

Possibilité d’acheter des vacances ou de vendre celles auxquelles vous avez droit, selon votre style de vie

Contribution à nos initiatives de responsabilité sociale centrées sur l’accès à l’éducation, l’accès à la technologie et le soutien aux communautés, tout en ayant une incidence positive sur la collectivité

Participation à nos célébrations ainsi qu’à nos événements sociaux et professionnels en dehors des lieux de travail

Occasions de partager vos idées novatrices et d’être rémunéré pour celles-ci!

Avantages et réductions pour les employés

Accent mis sur la diversité et l’inclusivité



Être au cœur du processus d’embauche à titre de partenaire de recrutement est un travail sans pareil. Vous êtes proche de l’entreprise, tout en étant en contact avec le monde externe, et vous présentez à certains des meilleurs talents qui soient les occasions les plus enrichissantes sur le marché. Vous résolvez des problèmes, vous créez des liens entre les gens et vous agissez en tant que conseiller de confiance pour les dirigeants et les candidats. C’est ce que nous faisons au sein du groupe de l’acquisition de talents chez Siemens, et nous recrutons un partenaire en recrutement qui travaillera à notre bureau d’Oakville avec des arrangements de travail flexibles.


Notre occasion


Nos partenaires de recrutement travaillent directement avec les dirigeants d’entreprise pour définir leurs besoins en matière de recrutement, concevoir et exécuter des campagnes de recrutement pour susciter l’intérêt de personnes talentueuses à l’égard de notre entreprise. Vous mettrez à profit vos compétences pour conseiller et guider l’entreprise, effectuerez une recherche de candidats directement et communiquerez à la fois avec des candidats actifs et des candidats passifs à divers niveaux. Notre passion consiste à offrir aux candidats une expérience exceptionnelle, et nous voulons travailler avec des professionnels de l’acquisition de talents qui accordent de l’importance à une approche de recrutement proactive et personnelle. Nous agissons en tant que conseillers en talents auprès de nos intervenants en entreprise, et sommes réputés pour l’attention que nous portons aux détails, notre réactivité et notre approche créative en ce qui concerne l’acquisition de talents.


En quoi consistera votre rôle?




Diriger le processus de recrutement du début à la fin, mettre en place une stratégie optimale pour déterminer, sélectionner, évaluer et embaucher des candidats dans diverses professions et pour des postes de divers échelons.

Collaborer avec nos dirigeants d’entreprise pour exécuter les stratégies d’acquisition de talents et influencer la qualité de l’embauche afin de soutenir directement les objectifs commerciaux.

Maintenir vos connaissances à jour sur le marché des talents, les concurrents et les besoins d’affaires de Siemens dans votre portefeuille afin de mieux prévoir les bassins de talents accessibles et les tendances du marché.

Mettre en pratique votre passion pour l’acquisition de talents en établissant des liens, en tirant parti de votre présence professionnelle en ligne et dans les médias sociaux, et rechercher des talents au sein de votre réseau. Pour réussir dans ce rôle, il sera nécessaire de posséder des compétences en recherche de candidats pour bâtir et tenir à jour des bassins de candidats et des pipelines de talents.

Évaluer des candidats, tirer parti de divers outils, dont des entrevues téléphoniques et des évaluations au moyen d’une entrevue vidéo numérique, afin de présenter une liste de candidats au gestionnaire recruteur.

Agir en tant qu’ambassadeur de la marque Siemens auprès des candidats, assurer une expérience positive, fournir une rétroaction en temps opportun, et gérer les attentes.

Maintenir l’intégrité des données dans notre système de suivi des candidats (Avature) relativement à tous les aspects du processus.

Établir et maintenir de solides relations professionnelles avec des dirigeants et des partenaires internes qui prennent part à tous les aspects du processus de recrutement.

Participer à d’autres projets, s’il y a lieu.




Ce qu’il vous faudra pour réussir




Diplôme universitaire en ressources humaines, en affaires ou dans un domaine connexe

Minimum de 5 à 8 années d’expérience en recrutement, notamment de l’expérience dans un poste de recrutement en entreprise ou dans une agence/entreprise de recherche

Aptitude éprouvée à trouver des candidats à l’aide d’une variété de circuits et de réseaux de recherche

Expertise approfondie en ce qui concerne les pratiques exemplaires relatives au recrutement, notamment des connaissances exhaustives sur la réglementation relative à l’emploi liée au recrutement, les pratiques exemplaires en matière de diversité et d’inclusion, et une approche novatrice et flexible relativement à la stratégie de recherche de candidats

Expérience requise en ce qui a trait aux outils et à la technologie de pointe, notamment un système de suivi des candidats et de la fonctionnalité Recruiter de LinkedIn

Personne résiliente, vive, passionnée et tournée vers l’avenir

Le candidat doit être un communicateur exceptionnel et reconnu pour sa mentalité axée sur l’apprentissage

Il doit être reconnu pour sa capacité d’exercer une influence d’une façon positive et constructive, et apprécié pour sa crédibilité en tant que conseiller de confiance 

Aptitude éprouvée à travailler efficacement sous pression dans un milieu qui évolue rapidement, de pair avec une solide capacité à comprendre les facteurs urgents et à établir des priorités

Le candidat doit adopter et promouvoir le changement. Il doit constamment adapter sa façon de penser et sa façon de travailler afin de donner le meilleur de lui-même

Bilinguisme (français et anglais), un atout




À propos de nous



Nous partageons nos idées et soutenons les personnes derrière celles-ci


Depuis plus de 110 ans, Siemens Canada est synonyme d’excellence en ingénierie, d’innovation, de qualité et de fiabilité. Siemens Canada est un leader technologique qui offre des solutions complètes dans les domaines des infrastructures intelligentes, du gaz et de l’énergie ainsi que des industries numériques. Nous faisons de ce qui importe une réalité en établissant des normes par notre façon d’alimenter en électricité, d’automatiser et de numériser le monde qui nous entoure. L’ingéniosité nous stimule, et ce que nous créons ensemble vous appartient.

Nous avons changé les choses ensemble en recueillant 565 000 $ au profit d’œuvres de charité, en soutenant plus de 50 organismes sans but lucratif et en plantant 1 850 arbres dans nos collectivités locales. Siemens Canada génère des ventes d’une valeur de 2,2 milliards de dollars et compte 4 800 employés. Joignez-vous à notre équipe d’environ 377 000 professionnels talentueux dans plus de 200 pays/régions et aidez-nous à relever les défis les plus stimulants pour bâtir un avenir prospère. Alors, qu’attendez-vous? Entamez la prochaine étape de votre carrière avec nous.

Pour en apprendre davantage sur Siemens Canada, veuillez visiter notre site Web au www.siemens.ca.

Toutes les demandes nous intéressent; toutefois, nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidat(e)s sélectionné(e)s.


Secteur:
 People & Organization


Entreprise:
 Siemens Canada Limited


Niveau d'expérience:
 Expérimenté


Type de poste:
 Temps plein

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.


By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Code available at www.siemens.ca.


Siemens s’engage à créer un environnement diversifié et est fière d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour ce poste.


En transmettant des renseignements personnels à Siemens Canada limitée ou à ses sociétés affiliées, à ses fournisseurs de services ou à ses agents, vous nous autorisez à recueillir, à utiliser et à divulguer ces renseignements aux fins prévues dans notre Code de protection de la confidentialité, que vous pouvez consulter au www.siemens.ca.

Expertise approfondie en ce qui concerne les pratiques exemplaires relatives au recrutement, notamment des connaissances exhaustives sur la réglementation relative à l’emploi liée au recrutement, les pratiques exemplaires en matière de diversité et d’inclusion, et une approche novatrice et flexible relativement à la stratégie de recherche de candidats

Expérience requise en ce qui a trait aux outils et à la technologie de pointe, notamment un système de suivi des candidats et de la fonctionnalité Recruiter de LinkedIn

Personne résiliente, vive, passionnée et tournée vers l’avenir

Le candidat doit être un communicateur exceptionnel et reconnu pour sa mentalité axée sur l’apprentissage

Il doit être reconnu pour sa capacité d’exercer une influence d’une façon positive et constructive, et apprécié pour sa crédibilité en tant que conseiller de confiance 

Aptitude éprouvée à travailler efficacement sous pression dans un milieu qui évolue rapidement, de pair avec une solide capacité à comprendre les facteurs urgents et à établir des priorités

Le candidat doit adopter et promouvoir le changement. Il doit constamment adapter sa façon de penser et sa façon de travailler afin de donner le meilleur de lui-même

Bilinguisme (français et anglais), un atout




À propos de nous



Nous partageons nos idées et soutenons les personnes derrière celles-ci


Depuis plus de 110 ans, Siemens Canada est synonyme d’excellence en ingénierie, d’innovation, de qualité et de fiabilité. Siemens Canada est un leader technologique qui offre des solutions complètes dans les domaines des infrastructures intelligentes, du gaz et de l’énergie ainsi que des industries numériques. Nous faisons de ce qui importe une réalité en établissant des normes par notre façon d’alimenter en électricité, d’automatiser et de numériser le monde qui nous entoure. L’ingéniosité nous stimule, et ce que nous créons ensemble vous appartient.

Nous avons changé les choses ensemble en recueillant 565 000 $ au profit d’œuvres de charité, en soutenant plus de 50 organismes sans but lucratif et en plantant 1 850 arbres dans nos collectivités locales. Siemens Canada génère des ventes d’une valeur de 2,2 milliards de dollars et compte 4 800 employés. Joignez-vous à notre équipe d’environ 377 000 professionnels talentueux dans plus de 200 pays/régions et aidez-nous à relever les défis les plus stimulants pour bâtir un avenir prospère. Alors, qu’attendez-vous? Entamez la prochaine étape de votre carrière avec nous.

Pour en apprendre davantage sur Siemens Canada, veuillez visiter notre site Web au www.siemens.ca.

Toutes les demandes nous intéressent; toutefois, nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidat(e)s sélectionné(e)s.

description:
Company Description



Let your passion fly! We're proud to be one of the world's leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that's straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won't be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!

Role Introduction

Cathay Pacific Airways is looking for a motivated individual to join the Americas People team as a People Coordinator based in Vancouver, BC. This Regular Full-Time position will play a key role in coordinating and ensuring compliance of Human Resource functions and operations. The successful candidate will also engage with and provide administrative support to all employees.

Key Responsibilities

People Administration and Compliance


 Apply standard documented and locally compliant Human Resources processes

 Utilize HRIS to accurately record employee information and ensure it is up-to-date at all times

 Ensure that local time keeping and leave monitoring are conducted in an effective and compliant manner

 Ensure all Human Resources documentation and filing/e-filing is conducted in a locally compliant and efficient manner

 Ensure all personal data handling and processes are locally compliant and adhere to company best practices

 Conduct local legislative reporting to government and other regulatory bodies in a timely and accurate manner

 Issue relevant employee letters and support employment-related administration for all employees in Canada and the US

 Conduct onboarding and off-boarding processes effectively, including issuing and collecting company property,as required

 Interact with the Finance/Payroll team on matters such as generating purchase orders, reconciling employee benefits costs and premiums and other key tasks

 With the support of Regional People team and Managers, participate in regular reviews of Human Resources compliance processes, identify legislative changes that impact our policies or procedures and provide practical advice and ideas to ensure local compliance and effective implementation

 Collaborate with the US-based counterpart to ensure efficient cross-training and exceptional teamwork

 Manage all office-related tasks in the Vancouver office, including liaising with the landlord

 Any other reasonable task or project as requested


Employee Queries and Support


 Act as the day to day point of contact for Human Resources inquiries from both, line managers and employees

 Provide advice on Human Resources policies, employee entitlements and day to day processes

 Escalate complex queries to the appropriate Manager, or regional People team for advice and timely support


Employee Communications and Engagement


 Assist with day-to-day initiatives regarding employee engagement, communication and recognition; for example coordinating meetings, training, events and managing the local SharePoint site and Company Intranet

 Support Managers with the smooth operations of people communication, engagement and associated activities

 Proactively identify opportunities for local celebrations or events to acknowledge local holidays, achievements etc.

 Coordinate long service awards and celebrations in a timely and engaging manner

 Provide logistical support for recruitment and selection processes as required

 Support operational teams in matters of communications and employee briefings with onsite support across all locations


Reporting


 Produce reports for Managers regarding Human Resources performance and metrics

 Proactively generate necessary reports to track performance of various issues such as outstanding vacation liability, completion of key processes and other items as required

 Track local budget items and report to the Regional Head Office as required




Requirements




 A diploma in Human Resources administration and desire to achieve membership in CPHR are definite advantages

 Basic knowledge and experience in Human Resources administration

 Ability to learn new tasks quickly and desire to find solutions to new problems

 Effective communication skills

 High attention to detail

 Ability to maintain confidentiality is a must

 Effective in managing day to day processes and competing priorities

 Collaborative and energetic

 Strong internal customer service mindset

 Experience in working with a global organization is an advantage

 Adaptable to change

 Must comply with the Company's mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination policy

 Must have the right to live and work in Canada


Personal & Application Information

Cathay Pacific Airways Limited is committed to employment equity, supports diversity in the workplace and encourages application from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.

description:
Are you looking for more than a job? At World Vision Canada we offer challenging careers that change the lives of children all over the world and it will change yours too. Come and be part of a team of 400 Canadians with a vision for the world: Life in all its fullness for every child.

You will experience Christian faith in action helping to make real and lasting change in the lives of the world’s most vulnerable children. Join the World Vision Canada team and be part of a powerful and effective force for good:

For Children. For Change. For Life.


 Position 

 : Associate, Employee Experience 



 Reports to: 

 People & Culture Manager, Talent Shared Services 



 Position Term: 

 Full Time Temporary (12 Months) 



 Primary Location:Mississauga, Ontario, Canada 



 Workplace Type:Flexible Hybrid 


#LI- OA1


Job Description


We are looking for an enthusiastic People & Culture Employee Experience Associate with a passion for creating and delivering an engaging and seamless end to end employee experience.Reporting to the People & Culture Manager, Talent Shared Services, the Associate will have a passion for hospitality, building relationships, communication, and inclusion to ensure all team members feel a sense of belonging and purpose at World Vision Canada.


Responsibilities



 Develop a best-in-class end-to-end onboarding and integration process to ensure employees at all levels are integrated and fully assimilated into the organization effectively and feel that they belong; coordinate with internal partners such as Digital & IT, Facilities, and hiring managers to provide a seamless onboarding experience. 

 Ensure all aspects of new hire compliance and internal learning modules are completed within the required timeline by all incoming employees. 

 Meet with new hires to provide organizational information as well as coordinate other key meet-and-greet sessions with key internal stakeholders, including senior leaders. Conduct presentations and moderate online platforms to ensure new hires have timely and required information. 

 Ensure the employee offboarding process is seamless with the coordination of all relevant internal partners. 

 Conduct and analyze onboarding and exit surveys, and monitor Our Voice and Pulse Survey data, to obtain insights and identify employee experience trending; provide recommendations and best practice learning to improve experience programs and processes. 

 Work with internal teams to test and continuously improve digitally enabled processes for all employee systems to ensure processes are effective and efficient. 

 In collaboration with Brand & Communications Engagement team, support the execution of our Employer Brand strategy both internally and externally including leading the Top 100 Employers project annually. 

 Oversight of all People & Culture online employee resources including intranet and social networking platforms; coordinate communications with internal partners. 

 Be an internal champion for legislative-related People & Culture policies and procedures including leaves, health & safety, accessibility, and other requirements; be a member of internal teams and/or working groups related to employee experience initiatives. 

 Support the People & Culture team with special initiatives as required. 




Qualifications



 Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management or related field 

 3+ years’ work experience in a similar role 

 Progress towards CHRP designation 

 Good knowledge of Canadian employment legislation 

 Hands-on experience with Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS); and strong skills in Microsoft Office including Teams and other intranet and organizational social network platforms 

 Solid communication skills (verbal and written) 

 Strong team spirit and collaboration 

 Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information 




 Why consider us? 



 World Vision Canada has consistently been awarded Canada’s and the GTA’s top employers. Other awards granted are for financial transparency, marketing, customer service and for the work we do in the field. 

 We are Canada’s largest development, relief and advocacy non-profit. 

 We embody an agile mindset here. 

 You get competitive pay and benefits. Our benefits start at day 1. 

 You get extra time off for restoration. We close for an additional day on long weekends, 6 times a year. 



We bring life-saving support in times of disaster. We help poor communities to take charge of their futures. We provide small loans and training that boost family livelihoods. We work with policy makers to change the way the world is run. Our Christian faith teaches us that every child, regardless of gender, faith or race, is a precious gift to the entire world - and that their wellbeing concerns us all. We shall never rest while children suffer in situations that can be changed.

GTA's Top 100

Our Core Values: We are committed to the Poor. We are Christian. We are Stewards. We value People. We are Partners. We are Responsive.

Qualified candidates must be able to demonstrate a commitment to the core values and mission of the World Vision partnership.

World Vision Canada takes our Safeguarding responsibilities seriously and we provide an environment that is safe for our child and adult beneficiaries. We have strong recruitment procedures to make sure the safest and most suitable people work with the children in our programs. We provide our staff and volunteers with ongoing supervision, support and training in their work with child and adult beneficiaries.

World Vision Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Thank you for your interest; however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Apply Now

description:
Head Office Toronto 
Why join us?


Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a dynamic and highly motivated Associate, Talent Acquisition to join our Talent Acquisition team. In this role you will be leading a high volume of recruitment efforts to support Pensions, Corporate Services & Communications functions across corporate portfolio at OMERS. You will be responsible for full cycle recruitment while providing best in class support to hiring managers throughout the entire recruitment, hiring and onboarding process. You will be a key member of our Talent Acquisition team as we drive a best in class candidate and stakeholder experience.


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for 



You will act as a talent advisor to support hiring managers with creating job descriptions and postings, identifying, screening, interviewing, managing offer and onboarding process.

Creating and executing sourcing strategies to build a pipeline of candidates, leveraging LinkedIn, Indeed, ATS database and other internal tools to build diverse talent pools of candidates.

Establishing connections, maintaining and leveraging a professional online and social media presence, and prospecting top talent through your network.

Developing and maintaining strong working relationships with HR Business Partners, People Experience (PEX) and Centre of Excellence (CoE) teams.

Providing trusted advice to hiring managers by using diverse interviewing and assessment techniques to validate candidate experience levels.

Representing OMERS as the main point of contact for all candidates’ correspondence and delivering a best-in-class candidate experience by managing your talent pipeline, acknowledging all applicants, and engaging in regular communication.

Maintaining accurate recruitment data and records in Workday and SharePoint

Keeping up to date on market trends and competitor information, providing business partners with insights and recommendations that will improve the quality of external hires.

Participating in process improvement projects across Talent Acquisition and within broader HR team

Supporting with employer branding initiatives and management of job fairs/hiring events as needed



To succeed in this role, you have 



2-3 years’ experience in full cycle recruitment within a corporate environment; high volume, financial services or consulting experience would be an asset. Prior experience in agency environment would be an asset.

An undergraduate degree or equivalent.

Strong knowledge of recruitment methods, best practices, and policies.

The ability to recruit for both junior and senior level roles across the organization, as well as high-volume recruitment with a strong focus on proactive sourcing & pipelining

Proven experience as an independent, resourceful self-starter with excellent judgment

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work with all levels in the organization.

Professionalism and strong interpersonal skills

The ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality

Adaptability and exceptional time management and organization skills

Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams, etc.)

Proficiency with an applicant tracking systems (i.e. Workday), with the ability to train hiring managers on how to complete various tasks through the system

Knowledge of various recruitment platforms such as LinkedIn Recruiter and Indeed Resume

The ability to thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt

 
Our story 


Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.


 Vaccination Policy 


At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Posted Today Full time JR-2696

Working with us is more than just a job – it is an opportunity to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. Our employees take great pride in serving the communities in which they live and contributing in a variety of ways to make important community-based initiatives possible globally.

Department of Tourism, Heritage and Culture

General Manager - Larry's Gulch Lodge

Contract

(February to December 2022, renewable)

Kedgwick

Who we are

Join the New Brunswick Parks and Trails team! We have the opportunity to work in some of the most beautiful places that New Brunswick has to offer while providing meaningful and challenging work. Imagine being able to experience the beauty of the world-class Restigouche River every day!

The Trails, Fish and Wildlife unit works collaboratively with stakeholders and industry members to support, promote, and grow this sector while encouraging New Brunswickers and visitors to discover these outdoor activities and experiences.

What you will do



Larry's Gulch



Reporting to the Trails, Fish and Wildlife Development Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day management and operations of Larry's Gulch Lodge, the government-owned salmon fishing lodge located on the Restigouche River in Kedgwick and will assist in the implementation of the fish and wildlife sector development. The duties and responsibilities will include:


 Providing overall leadership and guidance to a team responsible for the operations of Larry's Gulch Lodge to ensure exceptional client experience and service delivery is provided.

 Overseeing all day-to-day operations and maintenance of the site, including food and beverage services, accommodations and hospitality services, guiding services and customer service.

 Conducting all financial functions and transactions, including reservations, payments and invoicing of clients, monthly budget projections and expenditure control while ensuring profitability through budgetary adherence as well as identifying and coordinating capital projects.

 Managing human resources including all aspects of staffing, scheduling, recruiting, training, conflict resolution, collective agreement administration and performance management.

 Maintaining and following conservation standards for the Restigouche River.

 Developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders throughout the community.

 Assisting the Trails, Fish and Wildlife Development Manager with a strategic implementation to develop and elevate the experiences offered at the Lodge.




Fish & Wildlife Sector




 Assisting the Trails, Fish and Wildlife Development manager in the development and implementation of the Fish and Wildlife sector strategy.

 Liaising with government departments as it pertains to appropriate requirements for the fish and wildlife sector.

 Coordinating of initiatives for the implementation of the Fish & Wildlife Sector strategy.

 Participating in Fish and Wildlife sector annual general meetings, government-led meetings and private meetings as the departmental representative,

 Any other duties as required.


Work Environment


 Must reside on site 24 hours a day from June 1 to September 15

 Variable and extended hours.

 We promote a scent-reduced environment.


Who you are

You are someone who is experienced in successfully operating a hospitality, food and beverage property and maintaining its financial viability while exceeding client expectations. You have knowledge and experience in the salmon fishing and outdoor sectors. You demonstrate strong leadership with your team and are able to work remotely with minimal supervision. You also possess strong interpersonal, communication skills and are self-motivated.



We Are Looking For Diverse Backgrounds That Bring a Combination Of The Following



Your skills and interests are just as important as your area of study.

Need to have

A University degree and a minimum of five (5) years of related work experience which includes two (2) years of hospitality, food and beverage management experience; or a post-secondary diploma of two (2) years in Business Administration, Hospitality and Tourism, Parks and Recreation or a related field and a minimum of seven (7) years of related work experience which includes two (2) years of management experience.


 Considerable experience in using Microsoft Office 365 software and applications.

 Considerable experience and knowledge in the salmon fishing sector. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

 Written and spoken competence in English and Spoken competence in French is required. Please state your language capability.


Nice to have


 Experience in the wildlife (hunting, angling) industry.

 Experience in the tourism industry.

 Experience in marketing and developing experiences.

 Experience in developing community partnerships and initiatives.


Wage

$2,218.00 to $3,097.00 bi-weekly (Pay Band 5). Room, board, and meals are provided as part of the remuneration package from June 1 to September 15.

What can GNB offer you?


 Comprehensive benefits package and the Public Service Shared Risk Pension Plan.

 Opportunities for career growth, professional development and training.

 Free access to Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) and services.


Providing a safe workplace for all. Your health and safety are important to us. GNB has implemented preventative measures across the organization to ensure your health and safety.

How to apply

We encourage applicants to apply on-line, by e-mail to thchumres@gnb.ca or by mail at the following address indicating competition number R18-2021/22-1040. This competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same level.

Department of Tourism, Heritage and Culture

Human Resource Branch

Marysville Place, 4th floor

P.O. Box 6000, Fredericton, NB E3B 5H1

(506) 453-3115

This competition will remain open until the position is filled.

Any candidate not currently employed in the New Brunswick Public Service will need to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (or a valid medical certificate exempting them from the vaccine) in order to receive a job offer.

We thank all those who apply, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities in which we live and serve. We encourage and support applications from Aboriginals, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. Candidates registered with the Equal Employment Opportunity Program and veterans, who are among the most qualified, will be given preference at the time of selection.

industries: Non-profit Organizations, Staffing and Recruiting, and Government Administration
description:
Informations générales


Être au coeur de l'embauche du personnel d'une grande institution et mettre à profit votre expertise en dotation vous stimule? Un poste vous attend!

Sous la responsabilité du directeur de la section Services-conseils en ressources humaines, la technicienne ou le technicien en gestion des ressources humaines effectue diverses tâches relatives à la mise en application de normes et de procédures administratives reliées à la gestion des ressources humaines, et en particulier celles concernant l'attraction et la dotation du personnel. Elle ou il effectue divers travaux à caractère administratif et exerce auprès des gestionnaires, un rôle de soutien technique et de recherche dans son domaine de compétence.


Responsabilités générales



 Participer à la planification, à l'organisation et à la coordination des activités des différents volets de la gestion des ressources humaines et de la planification de la main d'oeuvre, plus particulièrement en matière de dotation pour le personnel de soutien.

 Exercer un rôle de soutien auprès des gestionnaires ainsi que des conseillères et conseillers en gestion des ressources humaines relativement à la dotation et à l'administration des dossiers du personnel.

 Prendre part à l'élaboration des objectifs de développement de sa section, se tenir au courant des nouvelles tendances dans son domaine de compétences et faire des suggestions sur les améliorations à y apporter.



Responsabilités spécifiques



 Planifier, organiser et coordonner les activités administratives et techniques reliées à la dotation du personnel de soutien interne et externe, notamment le recrutement, la sélection, l'analyse de candidatures, la gestion des listes de rappel et de disponibilité, l'administration des tests d'embauche, les évaluations salariales, l'accueil et la saisie de données au dossier informatisé du personnel.

description:
Staff - Non Union

Job Category

M&P - AAPS
Job Profile
AAPS Salaried - Research and Facilitation, Level D

Job Title

Senior Project Manager - RID Research Team

Department

Money Laboratory | Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology | Faculty of Medicine

Compensation Range

7,933.42 - $12,395.83 CAD Monthly

Posting End Date

March 17, 2022

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.


Job End Date


Mar 31, 2023

This offer is conditional upon successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.

This position is located within a health-care facility, therefore, the successful candidate will be required to provide verification of full vaccination against Covid-19 provided prior to the start date, as required by a provincial health mandate.



Job Summary



This position is responsible for high level research management and leadership of the Reproductive Infectious Disease research team, located at BC Women’s Hospital, reporting to Dr. Deborah Money. Along with a number of longer-standing studies, the team is contributing to the Canadian pandemic response with a suite of projects designed to understand the impact of COVID-19 on pregnant people and their infants.

The Senior Project Manager will be integral in overseeing multiple on-going research studies, and will contribute to strategic planning for the Reproductive Infection Disease Research Program, including supporting future funding applications. The Senior Project Manager would be responsible for aligning the team to build out future research opportunities by supporting researchers in identifying funding sources and overseeing the development of their proposals, budgets and funding applications, work plans and timelines. The Senior Project Manager will also make professional decisions and recommendations on most aspects of existing research work and will be responsible for the quality of research activities, human resource management, and financial management.

This position will be located at BC Women’s hospital, Vancouver BC.


Organizational Status


This position will report directly to Dr Deborah Money, who holds is a Professor at UBC and leads the Reproductive Infectious Diseases (RID) program. This position will manage and directly supervise managers, coordinators, assistants, students and volunteers. This individual will work closely with other research and administrative staff in the Department of OBGYN, at WHRI, and other research institutes across Canada. This individual will also work closely with UBC and PHSA employees. The nature of the work requires independent action and judgment with Dr. Money’s oversight.


Work Performed



Provides leadership and strategic direction to the research team in collaboration with the Principal Investigator.

Supervises and provides direction to research development staff, contractors and student hires including designing and implementing staff orientation resources and training staff Supervises and provides direction to research development staff on financial planning, management, and monitoring of all multi-million dollar study budgets. Ensures responsible financial practices in accordance with both the written UBC policies governing grant management, and the study funders.

Provides authoritative information on University, Faculty and funding agency administrative processes

Provides leadership, direction, facilitates and manages multi-recipient research collaboration across institutions, participates in research excellence recommendations, human resources management, and strategic planning.

Develops relationships with granting agencies, academic, research, professional organizations, and government stakeholders such as policy makers, community leaders/organizers, Indigenous leaders. Provides direction and leadership regarding political, cultural, financial or attitudinal barriers to achieving study objectives.

Plans and manages a large number of developing research proposals,works with the team to assist with exploring and identifying funding sources and developing funding applications. Develops and writes research proposals and submits proposals to funding organizations. Develops research project budget and prepares reports for funding agencies. Also, meets with funding agencies for updates and resolving issues.

Ensures that grants are completed and that sub-grantees fulfill contract deliverables annually, including budget targets, timeline targets, and project activity targets.

Oversees the research team to ensure appropriate keeping of research records (protocols, data and back-up of this information). Keep these essential documents in a safe and secured place. Manages all source documents to be available upon request.

Recruits and interviews the job candidates (Research assistants, research coordinators, research managers, summer students, co-op students, flex students and professional consultants).

Oversees all aspects of human resources management including supervising, mentoring, training, managing and evaluating the research managers, research coordinators, research assistants and technicians, staff and students. Analyzes and outlines the human resource needs of the research team inclusive of initiating, increasing or decreasing of staffing levels based on the project needs.

Provides expertise on a wide range of research areas.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


The Senior Project Manager will exercise vision, direction, professional judgment, initiative, and cultural and political sensitivity in the leadership of the Reproductive Infectious Diseases Research Program. The incumbent is required to conduct all activities in an ethical manner. Patient confidentiality must be respected when dealing with research data. Errors made could cause the ethics approval to be withdrawn, which would stop the project. Errors could influence the ability of research staff to meet critical deadlines, as well as compromise the results of the research project, and therefore affect the credibility of the investigators and the Department. As data and results may be disseminated to other research partners; their results, credibility, and ability to secure more funding could be negatively influenced. Poor decisions may be damaging to the reputation of the university and cause financial loss.


Supervision Received


This position reports directly to Dr. Deborah Money. It will provide direction and will oversee performance and results of the studies within the Reproductive Infectious Disease research program. This position works very independently and has considerable latitude. The Senior Project Manager will be expected to develop a work plan and timelines and exercise a considerable amount of judgement and initiative in duties and supervisory responsibilities.


Supervision Given


The Senior Project Manager will supervise staff and/or support colleagues in community-based partner organizations, Research Managers, Research Assistants, Research Coordinators. In conjunction with postdoctoral fellow and junior faculty will also supervise summer students, co-op students, undergraduate students and volunteers to ensure that the goals of various projects are met in a timely and efficient manner.



Minimum Qualifications



For research project leadership, a post-graduate degree or an equivalent professional designation is required with a minimum of five years of related experience, including experience in a field of specialization, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Otherwise, an undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline is required with a minimum of seven years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred Qualifications



Graduate degree in science is preferred; Masters in health sciences is ideal. Experience in clinical research and national/international project management, including established grant and peer review publication record experience. Ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to analyze and interpret data, determine implications, and provide recommendations. Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment. Ability to analyze problems, identify key information and issues, and effectively resolve issues. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.

About KEV:

 

KEV Group is an enterprise SaaS company providing online payment and accounting software to simplify student activity fund management in schools. KEV’s easy- to-use web-based software automates the collection, disbursement and management of student funds, thereby reducing the time it takes to receive and account for all school activity fees and increasing the time teachers can spend on education. The company is based in Toronto, with offices in the US. KEV is a portfolio company of Serent Capital, a leading middle market private equity firm focused on high growth technology businesses.

 

Why Join KEV?

 


Work in an industry that benefits children, parents and schools

Do meaningful and purpose-driven work, and make a real impact

Join a quickly growing organization with real opportunity for learning and growth

Passionate and accessible leadership team that cares about people, personally and professionally

Flexible work environment








Job Description




The Client Success Manager is a trusted advisor to KEV clients and guides their success with KEV School Cash products. The CSMs work closely with their client districts and the schools within each district to build capability of School Cash Online. This role requires that the CSM have a strong blend of product and domain expertise, business acumen, and communication skills. The CSM must effectively collaborate with a wide array of internal teams (Support, Sales, Marketing, Product Development) to orchestrate and optimize the customer experience.

Engaging customers and educating them on the available resources

Communicating the product roadmap

Guiding customer success through a thorough understanding of customers’ business objectives and success metrics

Actively managing the account customer experience with recurring meetings to track success and related activities and actions

Updating customer health

Preparing and coordinating periodic business reviews

Identifying opportunities for account growth

Delivering best practice guidance.

Advocating for product enhancements on behalf of customers


 

Success Measures





Sales support

Client satisfaction

Retention

Upsell lead generation





 Skills and Experience





3 years of experience managing customer relationships

School accounting, bookkeeping domain knowledge, 3 or more years of experience

Experience with School Cash Suite of products is an asset.

Account planning experience

Ability to establish and foster relationships at multiple levels in an organization

Proven ability to advise on and facilitate business adoption

Demonstrated project management capability

Excellent written and verbal communication

Strong presentation and problem-solving skills

 Experience working with cross-functional teams and collaborating to deliver an optimized customer experience and drive value for the customer

Self-driven with the energy and resilience to perform consistently and at a high level in a fast-paced, complex environment

Job Description Corporate Safety Programs Manager


Position Description

Reporting to the Human Resources Director, the Manager, Corporate Safety Programs will play both a strategic and hands-on role in the development, design, and administration of health & safety initiatives for multiple business units across Canada.

In this role, you will oversee the provision of all elements related to employee safety.

In addition to providing subject matter expertise to senior leadership, the Manager, Corporate Safety Programs will work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders and peers to evolve and enhance CGI’s health & safety programs.

In a rapidly growing organization within a dynamic industry, this role is integral to our future. Qualified candidates will possess a minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in creating and sustaining a safety-aware culture, and have the demonstrated ability to quickly establish credibility across all levels of the organization.

Your future duties and responsibilities


 Plan, direct and continuously improve CGI’s safety program to ensure a safe, healthy and incident free work environment.

 Consult with senior leadership and HR Partners to develop and deploy strategies to address business needs

 Develop and implement practices that ensure sustained compliance with all federal and provincial safety regulations.

 Act as corporate contact for third party requests for information (federal, provincial safety or risk management authority).

 Work in partnership with the Corporate Health and Well Being team to develop and support comprehensive wellness strategies for CGI employees across Canada




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role



 University degree in occupational health and safety or other relevant field of study

 Canadian Registered Safety Professional (CRSP) and/or Health and Safety Auditor Training preferred

 Accustomed to working in fast paced, high growth, highly matrixed organization

 Experience with designing, implementing and monitoring the success of employee wellness programs

 Extensive experience and understanding of Health and Safety Legislation, practices, management systems, protocols and procedures

 Highly effective leadership, relationship management and negotiation capabilities

 Self-starter, motivated, enthusiastic with a strong desire to succeed

Superior communication skills in both English and French are required.




Build your career with us.


It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Chef de service, Programmes de sécurité de l’entreprise


Job Description


Le Chef de service, Programmes de sécurité de l’entreprise relève du vice-président des ressources humaines et joue un rôle à la fois stratégique et pratique dans l’élaboration, la conception et l’administration d’initiatives de santé et sécurité pour plusieurs unités d’affaires au Canada.

À ce titre, il supervise la prestation de tous les éléments liés à la sécurité des employés. En plus de fournir une expertise à la haute direction, le gestionnaire principal, Programmes de sécurité de l’entreprise collabore avec les intervenants internes et ses pairs à l’amélioration et à l’évolution des programmes de santé et sécurité de CGI.

Dans une organisation évoluant rapidement au sein d’un secteur dynamique, ce rôle est essentiel à notre avenir. Les candidats qualifiés possèdent au moins 10 ans d’expérience en création et en maintien d’une culture sensibilisée à la sécurité, et ont démontré leur capacité à acquérir rapidement une crédibilité à tous les niveaux de l’organisation. Des compétences supérieures en communication en français et en anglais sont également requises.

Your future duties and responsibilities


 Planifier, diriger et améliorer sur une base continue le programme de sécurité de CGI afin d’assurer un environnement de travail sûr, sain et sans incident.

 Consulter la haute direction et les partenaires des RH relativement à l’élaboration et au déploiement des stratégies visant à répondre aux besoins d’affaires.

 Élaborer et mettre en œuvre des pratiques qui assurent une conformité continue à tous les règlements fédéraux et provinciaux en matière de sécurité.

 Agir à titre de personne-ressource pour les demandes de renseignements de tiers (autorités fédérales et provinciales en matière de sécurité ou de gestion des risques).

 Collaborer avec l’équipe responsable de la santé et du bien-être de l’entreprise à l’élaboration et au soutien de stratégies complètes de bien-être pour les employés de CGI au Canada.




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role



 Diplôme universitaire en santé et sécurité au travail ou dans un autre domaine d’études pertinent.

 Titre de professionnel en sécurité agréé (PSAC) ou de vérificateur en santé et sécurité préférable.

 Expérience de travail dans une organisation au rythme rapide, à forte croissance et hautement matricielle.

 Expérience en conception, en mise en œuvre et en suivi du succès des programmes de mieux-être des employés.

 Vaste expérience et profonde compréhension de la législation, des pratiques, des systèmes de gestion, ainsi que des protocoles et procédures en matière de santé et de sécurité.

 Capacités en négociation et en gestion des relations et leadership très efficaces.

 Sens de l’initiative, motivation, enthousiasme et vif désir de réussir.




Donnez un élan à votre carrière.


Le secteur des technologies de l’information (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de s’accélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et l’engagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture d’actionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de l’une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de l’information (TI) et en gestion des processus d’affaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Les candidatures non sollicitées provenant de cabinets de recrutement ne seront pas retenues.

CGI favorise l’équité en matière d’emploi. De plus, CGI s’engage à offrir des accommodements aux personnes handicapées, conformément à la législation provinciale. Veuillez nous indiquer si vous vivez avec un handicap nécessitant la mise en place d’accommodements raisonnables dans le cadre de notre processus de recrutement, nous collaborerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

description:

Director of Operations

Location

Moncton, NB

Type

Full-time, Permanent

Company Overview



Sysco connects the world to share food and care for one another. Sysco leads from the heart of food and service to deliver the freshest foods and fresh ideas. Our customers can count on us to deliver on-point products and solutions since only Sysco is the global leader, sitting at the heart of innovation supply, delivery, culinary and more.

With over 69,000 associates, the company operates more than 320 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 650,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2019 that ended June 29, 2019, the company generated sales of more than $60 billion.

Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2019, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Join our winning team.

For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada ; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada


 For a full list of opportunities, visit 
 
 www.sysco.ca/careers 




Role



This position is responsible for the accurate, efficient, and safe movement of cases onto our trucks and onward to our Customers. With, and through their team of Supervisors and Clerks they are responsible for directing and coordinating the activities of outbound warehouse workers engaged in selecting, loading, stacking food service and food related products.



Role Responsibilities




 Oversees the quality and accuracy of order selection 

 Ensures that loading activities are monitored by warehouse management staff. Ensures special loading requests are completed as requested 

 Monitors stocking and replenishment accuracy & efficiency 

 Monitors loading schedule requirements 

 Reviews and evaluates the cause of mis-shipments 

 Develops team and individual goals and objectives 

 Supports the implementation of programs with EHS 

 Develops and maintains communication with other departments to enhance the night warehouse’s overall organization and efficiency 

 Analyzes, identifies and proposes solutions to problems within the night warehouse operation 

 Determines work procedures, prepares work schedules and expedites workflow 

 Studies and standardizes procedures 

 Maintains harmony among workers and resolves grievances with HR support 

 Oversees investigation of customer complaints involving such matters as damaged items or mis-picks 

 Supports the training and development of staff 

 Supports the creation of, and reviews employee performance evaluations 

 Provides feedback on the performance of associates by monitoring activities and reports 

 Completes personnel records and forms as required 

 Assists in human resources actions as requested 

 If applicable, understand and interpret the CBA, participate in grievance, mediation, arbitration procedures at unionized facilities 

 Accountable for the accuracy of timecards, approvals and scheduling of direct reports. 

 Responsible for compliance with all Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) comprising Sysco’s Food Safety Program, specific for the assigned role. 

 Assist Food Safety Program Manager in ensuring compliance to Sysco’s Food Safety Program that leads to compliance with third party certification and customer requirements. 

 Understands that their role is critical in creating a safe organization with minimal environmental impact and the value that brings to the organization. 

 Is willing to drive Environmental, Health and Safety performance by acting as an example and holding their team accountable to complying with EHS programs, policies, and requirements. 

 Enable, champion and embrace an inclusive culture 

 Develop and support high performing talent through hiring, scheduling, performance coaching, and career management practices 

 Facilitate establishment of clear performance goals; Ensure that performance goals adapt to changing business demands; Identify and manage non-performers in a fair and timely way; Identify and reward top performance; links pay and performance through base, incentive, and recognition programs 

 Present oneself in a manner that demonstrates executive maturity, professionalism, trust, confidence, and integrity. 

 Communicates broadly and frequently the company's vision, direction, goals, performance against plan, changes, and expectations through participation in department meetings, one-on-one meetings, and informal conversations with associates 

 Perform other duties as assigned. 




Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements




 2+ years’ experience leading a team, experience leading front-line supervisors preferred. 

 Minimum High School diploma 

 Post-secondary education in a related field preferred. 

 Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, etc.)

 Full-time

Position Summary:





Work with District Manager and store team to ensure compliance with:


Customer service standards, Operating policies and procedures, and applicable provincial and federal legislation.

Work together with the District Managers and Store Staff to lead the store in the achievement of:

Operating efficiencies, Revenue goals, Profitability, and Customer satisfaction.

Responsible for sourcing, hiring, training and development of, their Store Team.






Essential Duties & Responsibilities:






Communication



Communications are to be professional, timely, thorough and proactive whenever possible.

All communications are to be delivered with consistency to all store team.

All customer communications are to be friendly and productive encouraging repeat business, customer satisfaction and increased sales.



People Management



Ensure that trends of underperformance are formally addressed, with clear and documented performance improvement plans.

Formally recognize strong performers within the assigned region.

Manage store team in compliance with operational, legislative and Human Resources operating policies and procedures.



Problem Solving



Work with store staff to resolve issues proactively and/or as they arise and report unresolved issues to the District Manager for support.



Accountability


Ensure the store team performs their job to Company standards and are held accountable for non-compliance.


Job Knowledge



Know our customer by interacting with the customer on the sales floor and observing shopping behaviors, and associate/customer experience.

Understand and administer operational and HR policies and procedures and ensure compliance with them, consistently between all store team members.

Understand and effectively apply operational requirements and reports to assist in the daily operation of the store.

Have a good understanding of our business, our competitors and how we can leverage our current assets in the surrounding market to ensure long term success.



Quality



Set high expectations for excellent customer service and hold the store team members accountable to the measurable results.

Ensure stores are “closing to open” and that throughout the day, clear and defined associate floor plans and management occurs to maintain visual/merchandising standards, coupled with an outstanding customer engagement culture.

Work with the store team members to ensure that the store merchandising environment is a point of differentiation aimed at getting a customer excited about the uniqueness of the offering, the possibilities that may exist, bringing product to life, inspiring a recipe of need, leading to a WOW marketing benefit.



Push For Results



Drive business success through the effective use of internal reports, retail results assessments, and the development, implementation and monitoring of SMART Goals (action plans) directly geared towards team member skills development, profitability, sales growth and customer satisfaction



Teamwork



Work with District Manager in the development of retail sales goals and action plans that are directly tied into measurable results and timely and consistent execution.

Work with District Managers to manage labour and vacation scheduling to budgeted models, both in hours and with the FT/PT ratio.

Work with the District Manager to ensure your store has the required staff necessary to run the store successfully in the short and long term

3-5 years’ experience as a retail manager

3-5 years’ experience supervising and/or leading people

3-5 years’ experience working in a retail environment (Food Retail experience is an asset)

3-5 years’ experience servicing and resolving customer concerns

Understanding of business management fundamentals

Post-secondary certificate in business or related field an asset

Must be able to lift 50lbs ore more as required by the business

Must have both POS and cash handling experience

Job Purpose


Reporting to the Health, Safety and Wellness Manager, the Health, Safety & Wellness Coordinator is responsible for providing support in all areas of health and safety. The incumbent will work alongside Area Leaders to ensure that health and safety compliance is maintained throughout CMP. Working closely with the Health, Safety and Wellness Manager the Coordinator will work to minimize occupational health and safety risks and incidents to achieve our goal of zero injuries and 100% compliance to all legislative requirements.





Why Work at Conestoga Meats?



Growing company with opportunity to grow with team and department

Stable full-time hours; no rotating shifts

Employee referral bonus program (minimum $300 per hire)

Competitive benefits package for you and your family at 3 months of service

Pension plan and company matching at 1 year of service

Floater day given on top of vacation days

Diverse workforce; translation of communication materials into 8 languages

Employee assistance program (financial assistance, mental health resources)

Social Committee events (food trucks, gifts, games)

BBQ's and wellness programs

On-site training and company provided equipment

Employee scholarship program and English courses






Duties and Responsibilities:


Update occupational health and safety legislative programs to ensure ongoing compliance


Assist Health, Safety and Wellness Manager to ensure that CMP follows all applicable health and safety legislation

Working alongside the Training Department, develop expert health and safety training to support our programs


Company Wide Health and Safety Support


Ergonomic Risk Assessments

Visual Job Instructions/Standard Work Instructions

Job Hazard Analysis

Physical Demands Descriptions

Health and Safety Risk Assessments

Discomfort Reporting and follow up

Shout Out Safety Program

Assist in H&S projects as requested by Health, Safety & Wellness Manager

Research and develop justifications for projects

Utilizing Change Management Tools, collaborating with all stakeholders to detail specific project deliverables 

Utilizing Change Management Tools, develop project plans for stakeholders

Perform onsite Factory Acceptance Tests (FATs) to ensure new equipment meets OHSA legislation and best practices prior to being introduced into production

Confirming all Pre-Start Health and Safety Reviews are scheduled, all non-compliances are, and recommendations are implemented prior to the equipment being introduced into production

Lead third party inspections and audits. Determine, implement and verify the corrective actions have been completed and are sustainable.


 Health and Safety Statistical Management 


Maintain current WSIB/STD statistics

Maintain Non-Occupational statistics (First Aid, Near Miss)

Maintain Pre-Offer of Employment Testing Statistics

Develop, implement and verify action plans specific to the injury data and department 

Train leadership on tools developed and related to statistics

Utilize and maintain the accuracy of discomfort reports to ensure credibility and efficiency in the statistical database


 Facilitate the Company’s Early and Safe Return to Work program


Communicate with the Human Resources Assistant to stay up to date with WSIB/STD claims

Participate in Workflow processing of claims

Back up Human Resource Assistant to complete Employer Statement or other inquiries in their absence

Review current medical documentation and communicate with supervisors regarding early and safe return to work

Monitor and meet with modified workers to ensure a safe and timely return to pre-injury duties

Update the Health, Safety & Wellness Manager on WSIB/STD

Attend Team Member WSIB/STD Return to Work Meetings

Review Accident Investigation reports and a follow up with supervisors and employees

Verify the Accident Investigation corrective actions have been completed

Communicate with our third-party disability management firm and WSIB on all aspects of claims management and provide required documentation

Monitor and meet with modified workers to ensure a safe and timely return to pre-injury duties



 
Management Co-Chair of the JHSC


Prepare agenda and documentation for JHSC

Attend meetings and take part in the monthly inspection walks

Revise meeting minutes, acquire sign offs and post minutes

Organize JHSC worker representative voting

Ensure all required JHSC postings (member pictures, etc.) are kept up to date


 Enhance and promote a strong health and safety culture


Enforce all established health and safety regulation and safe work practices in accordance with company policy

Maintain a visual presence in the plants assisting and identify workplace hazards

Create and distribute health and safety newsletter, bulletins and other forms of communication on a regular basis


Support Operations with Health, Safety & Wellness Coordinator Duties as Assigned


Cover vacation schedules

Lead operation projects as assigned

Assist fellow Health, Safety & Wellness Coordinator as required



 
Personal Development


Attend company required training

Remain current with technical knowledge in areas of responsibility

Attend regular 1:1 coaching/update sessions






What You Bring to the Position:



A degree/diploma in a related field and a Post-Secondary Certificate in Occupational Health and Safety

Minimum of 2 years working full time as a Health and Safety Coordinator or equivalent 

Working knowledge of the Occupational Health & Safety Act and Regulations, Human Rights and the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act

Experience with WSIB claims management, incident investigation, workplace inspection, ergonomics and risk assessments

Knowledge of workplace wellness programs and initiatives

Complete proficiency with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other common applications

Must be decisive, a collaborator and be able to work well under pressure

Ability to deal with tight deadlines effectively and efficiently, and day-to-day health and safety issues and concerns as they arise

Strong organizational skills

Strong persuasive written and verbal communication skills





If this sounds like the job for you, please submit your resume online at http://conestogameats.com.

 


We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those invited to participate in our recruitment process will be contacted.


 

Conestoga Meats welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.





About the Company


Conestoga Meat Packers is a leading processor of premium quality, fresh pork. Based in Breslau, ON, we have been supplying the market with wholesome, delicious pork since 1982. Our company is owned and supplied by a co-operative of Southern Ontario farmers who got into the business because they wanted to supply the Canadian market with the same pork their own families were enjoying. To this day we still pride ourselves on farm fresh pork; 
By families. For families.
